error: could not compile `no_type_annotations` due to previous error

B·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y c√°c ch√∫ th√≠ch ki·ªÉu kh√°c nhau cho nh·ªØng ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√°c.

C√°c ki·ªÉu v√¥ h∆∞·ªõng (Scalar type)

M·ªôt ki·ªÉu v√¥ h∆∞·ªõng bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã ƒë∆°n. Rust c√≥ b·ªën ki·ªÉu v√¥ h∆∞·ªõng ch√≠nh: s·ªë nguy√™n (integer), c√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông, boolean v√† ki·ªÉu k√Ω t·ª±. B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ th·∫•y ch√∫ng c≈©ng t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± trong c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·∫≠p tr√¨nh kh√°c. H√£y c√πng xem th·ª≠ trong Rust ch√∫ng ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông th·∫ø n√†o.

C√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë nguy√™n (integer)

M·ªôt integer l√† m·ªôt s·ªë kh√¥ng c√≥ ph·∫ßn th·∫≠p ph√¢n. Ch√∫ng ta ƒë√£ t·ª´ng d√πng m·ªôt ki·ªÉu integer trong ch∆∞∆°ng 2, ki·ªÉu u32. Vi·ªác khai b√°o ki·ªÉu n√†y ch·ªâ ra gi√° tr·ªã m√† n√≥ k·∫øt h·ª£p ph·∫£i l√† m·ªôt s·ªë nguy√™n kh√¥ng d·∫•u (c√°c ki·ªÉu c√≥ d·∫•u s·∫Ω b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu b·∫±ng ch·ªØ i thay v√¨ u), v√† n√≥ chi·∫øm 32 bit kh√¥ng gian nh·ªõ. B·∫£ng 3-1 tr√¨nh b√†y c√°c ki·ªÉu integer ƒë∆∞·ª£c h·ªó tr·ª£ s·∫µn b·ªüi Rust. Ch√∫ng ta c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng b·∫•t k·ª≥ bi·∫øn th·ªÉ n√†o trong danh s√°ch ƒë·ªÉ khai b√°o m·ªôt ki·ªÉu nguy√™n.

Table 3-1: C√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë nguy√™n trong Rust

LengthSignedUnsigned
8-biti8u8
16-biti16u16
32-biti32u32
64-biti64u64
128-biti128u128
archisizeusize

M·ªói bi·∫øn th·ªÉ c√≥ th·ªÉ c√≥ ho·∫∑c kh√¥ng c√≥ d·∫•u, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi s·∫Ω c√≥ m·ªôt k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc c·ª• th·ªÉ. Signed v√† unsigned ch·ªâ ra li·ªáu m·ªôt ki·ªÉu c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ª©a s·ªë √¢m hay kh√¥ng, hay n√≥i c√°ch kh√°c ta c√≥ c·∫ßn vi·∫øt d·∫•u cho n√≥ hay kh√¥ng (khi n√≥ ch·ª©a m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã √¢m). N√≥ c≈©ng ho√†n to√†n t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± khi b·∫°n vi·∫øt ra gi·∫•y: N·∫øu d·∫•u l√† quan tr·ªçng, b·∫°n c·∫ßn vi·∫øt r√µ con s·ªë v·ªõi d·∫•u c·ªông ho·∫∑c tr·ª´; tuy nhi√™n khi n√≥ an to√†n ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt s·ªë d∆∞∆°ng, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ b·ªè qua v√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn vi·∫øt d·∫•u. C√°c s·ªë √¢m ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr·ªØ d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn two‚Äôs complement.

M·ªói m·ªôt bi·∫øn th·ªÉ c√≥ d·∫•u c√≥ th·ªÉ l∆∞u c√°c con s·ªë t·ª´ -(2n - 1) ƒë·∫øn 2n - 1 - 1, v·ªõi n l√† s·ªë bit m√† bi·∫øn th·ªÉ ƒë√≥ d√πng. Nh∆∞ v·∫≠y m·ªôt bi·∫øn i8 c√≥ th·ªÉ l∆∞u c√°c gi√° tr·ªã t·ª´ -(27) ƒë·∫øn 27 - 1, t∆∞∆°ng ·ª©ng v·ªõi -128 ƒë·∫øn 127. C√°c bi·∫øn th·ªÉ kh√¥ng d·∫•u c√≥ th·ªÉ l∆∞u c√°c gi√° tr·ªã t·ª´ 0 ƒë·∫øn 2n - 1, do v·∫≠y m·ªôt bi·∫øn u8 c√≥ th·ªÉ l∆∞u ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·ª´ 0 ƒë·∫øn 28 - 1, t∆∞∆°ng ·ª©ng v·ªõi 0 ƒë·∫øn 255.

Th√™m v√†o ƒë√≥, c√°c ki·ªÉu isize v√† usize s·∫Ω ph·ª• thu·ªôc v√†o ki·∫øn tr√∫c h·ªá th·ªëng m√† ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh ch·∫°y tr√™n ƒë√≥ (ƒë∆∞·ª£c ghi trong b·∫£ng v·ªõi t√™n ‚Äúarch‚Äù): 64 bit n·∫øu ƒëang ch·∫°y tr√™n ki·∫øn tr√∫c 64 bit v√† 32 bit n·∫øu ch·∫°y tr√™n ki·∫øn tr√∫c 32 bit.

B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ vi·∫øt c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ki·ªÉu s·ªë nguy√™n theo b·∫•t k·ª≥ d·∫°ng n√†o trong b·∫£ng 3-2. L∆∞u √Ω l√† n·∫øu m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã s·ªë nguy√™n c√≥ th·ªÉ thu·ªôc nhi·ªÅu ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√°c nhau th√¨ b·∫°n c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ªâ r√µ ra m·ªôt ki·ªÉu c·ª• th·ªÉ n√†o ƒë√≥, v√≠ d·ª• 57u8. C√°c gi√° tr·ªã s·ªë c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng d·∫•u g·∫°ch d∆∞·ªõi nh∆∞ m·ªôt k√Ω hi·ªáu ph√¢n c√°ch d·ªÖ d·ªÖ nh√¨n h∆°n, nh∆∞ l√† 1_000, s·∫Ω c√≥ c√πng gi√° tr·ªã v·ªõi 1000.

Table 3-2: C√°c gi√° tr·ªã s·ªë nguy√™n trong Rust

C√°c gi√° tr·ªãV√≠ d·ª•

V·∫≠y l√†m sao b·∫°n bi·∫øt ƒë∆∞·ª£c ki·ªÉu s·ªë nguy√™n n√†o ƒë·ªÉ d√πng? N·∫øu kh√¥ng ch·∫Øc th√¨ h√£y nh·ªõ, m·∫∑c nhi√™n trong Rust c√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë nguy√™n s·∫Ω l√† i32. M·ªôt tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p m√† b·∫°n c√≥ l·∫Ω s·∫Ω d√πng t·ªõi isize hay usize l√† khi s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ch·ªâ s·ªë trong c√°c t·∫≠p h·ª£p.

Tr√†n s·ªë

L·∫•y v√≠ d·ª• b·∫°n c√≥ m·ªôt bi·∫øn ki·ªÉu u8 c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ª©a ƒë∆∞·ª£c gi√° tr·ªã t·ª´ 0 ƒë·∫øn 255. N·∫øu b·∫°n c·ªë thay ƒë·ªïi gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa bi·∫øn th√†nh m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã ngo√†i ph·∫°m vi ƒë√≥, ch·∫≥ng h·∫°n 256, integer overflow (l·ªói tr√†n s·ªë) s·∫Ω x·∫£y ra, v√† n√≥ s·∫Ω d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn m·ªôt trong hai tr·∫°ng th√°i. N·∫øu b·∫°n d·ªãch code ·ªü ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô debug, Rust s·∫Ω th√™m v√†o c√°c ph√©p ki·ªÉm tra tr√†n s·ªë v√† khi·∫øn ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh c·ªßa b·∫°n b·ªã d·ª´ng l·∫°i v√† tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt l·ªói nghi√™m tr·ªçng, Rust g·ªçi vi·ªác d·ª´ng l·∫°i n√†y l√† panicking; ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω th·∫£o lu·∫≠n th√™m v·ªÅ trong ph·∫ßn ‚ÄúUnrecoverable Errors with panic!‚Äù ·ªü ch∆∞∆°ng 9.

Khi d·ªãch ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh ·ªü ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô release v·ªõi t√πy ch·ªçn --release, Rust kh√¥ng th√™m v√†o c√°c ph√©p ki·ªÉm tra tr√†n s·ªë g√¢y d·ª´ng ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh. Thay v√†o ƒë√≥, n·∫øu x·∫£y ra tr√†n s·ªë, Rust s·∫Ω th·ª±c hi·ªán two‚Äôs complement wrapping. N√≥i m·ªôt c√°ch ng·∫Øn g·ªçn, c√°c gi√° tr·ªã l·ªõn h∆°n gi√° tr·ªã l·ªõn nh·∫•t m√† ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ª©a ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·∫Ω b·ªã "xoay v√≤ng" l·∫°i t·ª´ gi√° tr·ªã nh·ªè nh·∫•t. Trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p c·ªßa u8, gi√° tr·ªã 256 s·∫Ω quay v√≤ng l·∫°i 0, 257 tr·ªü th√†nh 1, v√† ti·∫øp t·ª•c nh∆∞ v·∫≠y. Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω kh√¥ng d·ª´ng do l·ªói, nh∆∞ng bi·∫øn c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ª©a m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã m√† b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng mong mu·ªën. Khi x·∫£y ra "xoay v√≤ng" l·∫°i gi√° tr·ªã, ta c√≥ th·ªÉ coi nh∆∞ m·ªôt l·ªói.

ƒê·ªÉ c√≥ th·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω vi·ªác tr√†n s·ªë m·ªôt c√°ch c·ª• th·ªÉ, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng c√°c nh√≥m ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c h·ªó tr·ª£ c√°c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu s·ªë nguy√™n th·ªßy ƒë∆∞·ª£c cung c·∫•p b·ªüi th∆∞ vi·ªán chu·∫©n:

  • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c bao b·ªçc wrapping_*, ki·ªÉu nh∆∞ wrapping_add.
  • Tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã None n·∫øu x·∫£y ra tr√†n s·ªë v·ªõi c√°c ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c checked_*.
  • Tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã v√† m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã bool ƒë·ªÉ ch·ªâ ra li·ªáu ƒë√£ x·∫£ ra tr√†n s·ªë hay kh√¥ng v·ªõi c√°c ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c overflowing_*.
  • Tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã l·ªõn nh·∫•t ho·∫∑c nh·ªè nh·∫•t c·ªßa ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu v·ªõi c√°c ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c saturating_*.

C√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông

Rust c≈©ng c√≥ hai ki·ªÉu nguy√™n th·ªßy cho c√°c s·ªë d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông (floating-point numbers), l√† c√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë c√≥ ph·∫ßn th·∫≠p ph√¢n. C√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông c·ªßa Rust g·ªìm c√≥ f32 v√† f64, t∆∞∆°ng ·ª©ng v·ªõi c√°c k√≠ch c·ª° 32 bit v√† 64 bit. Ki·ªÉu m·∫∑c nhi√™n l√† f64, v√¨ tr√™n c√°c b·ªô x·ª≠ l√Ω hi·ªán ƒë·∫°i t·ªëc ƒë·ªô x·ª≠ l√Ω c·ªßa n√≥ t∆∞∆°ng ƒë∆∞∆°ng v·ªõi f32 nh∆∞ng c√≥ ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c cao h∆°n. T·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c ki·ªÉu d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông ƒë·ªÅu l√† c√≥ d·∫•u.

ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• v·ªÅ vi·ªác d√πng c√°c d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let x = 2.0; // f64

    let y: f32 = 3.0; // f32
}

C√°c ki·ªÉu d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông ƒë∆∞·ª£c bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn d·ª±a tr√™n ti√™u chu·∫©n IEEE-754. Ki·ªÉu f32 l√† ki·ªÉu d·∫•u ch·∫•m ƒë·ªông ch√≠nh x√°c ƒë∆°n, v√† f64 c√≥ ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c k√©p.

C√°c to√°n t·ª≠ s·ªë

Rust h·ªó tr·ª£ c√°c ph√©p to√°n to√°n h·ªçc c∆° b·∫£n: c·ªông, tr·ª´, nh√¢n, chia v√† l·∫•y ph·∫ßn d∆∞. C√°c ki·ªÉu s·ªë nguy√™n khi chia s·∫Ω tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt s·ªë nguy√™n g·∫ßn nh·∫•t v·ªõi th∆∞∆°ng. ƒêo·∫°n code sau ƒë√¢y bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn c√°ch b·∫°n s·∫Ω d√πng c√°c to√°n t·ª≠ trong m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu let:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    // addition
    let sum = 5 + 10;

    // subtraction
    let difference = 95.5 - 4.3;

    // multiplication
    let product = 4 * 30;

    // division
    let quotient = 56.7 / 32.2;
    let truncated = -5 / 3; // Results in -1

    // remainder
    let remainder = 43 % 5;
}

M·ªói bi·ªÉu th·ª©c trong c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu ƒë√≥ d√πng m·ªôt to√°n t·ª≠ to√°n h·ªçc v√† tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã ƒë∆°n, gi√° tr·ªã n√†y sau ƒë√≥ l·∫°i ƒë∆∞·ª£c g√°n cho m·ªôt bi·∫øn. Appendix B ch·ª©a m·ªôt danh s√°ch t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c to√°n t·ª≠ c√≥ trong Rust.

Ki·ªÉu Boolean

T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± trong c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·∫≠p tr√¨nh kh√°c, m·ªôt ki·ªÉu Boolean c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ª©a m·ªôt trong hai gi√° tr·ªã true v√† false. Boolean c√≥ k√≠ch c·ª° m·ªôt byte. M·ªôt bi·∫øu ki·ªÉu Boolean trong Rust ƒë∆∞·ª£c khai b√°o s·ª≠ d·ª•ng bool. V√≠ d·ª•:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let t = true;

    let f: bool = false; // with explicit type annotation
}

C√°ch ch√≠nh ƒë·ªÉ d√πng Boolean l√† th√¥ng qua c√°c ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán, ki·ªÉu nh∆∞ ph√°t bi·ªÉu if. Ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω xem th√™m v·ªÅ c√°ch if l√†m vi·ªác trong Rust trong ph·∫ßn ‚ÄúC√°c kh·ªëi ƒëi·ªÅu khi·ªÉn‚Äù.

Ki·ªÉu k√Ω t·ª±

Ki·ªÉu char trong Rust l√† ki·ªÉu k√Ω t·ª± nguy√™n th·ªßy nh·∫•t. Sau ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt s·ªë v√≠ d·ª• v·ªÅ c√°ch khai b√°o c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ki·ªÉu char:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let c = 'z';
    let z: char = '‚Ñ§'; // with explicit type annotation
    let heart_eyed_cat = 'üòª';
}

L∆∞u √Ω l√† ch√∫ng ta ch·ªâ ra m·ªôt d·ªØ li·ªáu n√†o ƒë√≥ l√† ki·ªÉu char b·∫±ng c√°ch d√πng d·∫•u nh√°y ƒë∆°n, trong khi ƒë√≥ v·ªõi string th√¨ ta d√πng d·∫•u nh√°y k√©p. Ki·ªÉu char trong Rust c√≥ k√≠ch c·ª° 4 byte v√† bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn m·ªôt k√Ω t·ª± Unicode, do n√≥ n√≥ c√≥ th·ªÉ bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn nhi·ªÅu h∆°n nhi·ªÅu so v·ªõi ASCII. C√°c k√Ω t·ª± c·ªï, c√°c k√Ω t·ª± ti·∫øng Trung, ti·∫øng Nh·∫≠t, ti·∫øng H√†n; c√°c bi·ªÉu t∆∞·ª£ng c·∫£m x√∫c (emoji); v√† c·∫£ c√°c kho·∫£ng tr·ªëng c√≥ chi·ªÅu r·ªông b·∫±ng 0 ƒë·ªÅu l√† c√°c k√Ω t·ª± ki·ªÉu char h·ª£p l·ªá. C√°c k√Ω t·ª± Unicode c≈©ng bao g·ªìm c·∫£ t·ª´ U+0000 ƒë·∫øn U+D7FF v√† t·ª´ U+E000 ƒë·∫øn U+10FFFF. Tuy nhi√™n, "k√Ω t·ª±" l√† m·ªôt kh√°i ni·ªám kh√¥ng th·ª±c s·ª± ƒë∆∞·ª£c d√πng trong Unicode, do v·∫≠y c√°ch m√† b·∫°n nghƒ© v·ªÅ "k√Ω t·ª±" c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ho√†n to√†n gi·ªëng v·ªõi char trong Rust. Ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω th·∫£o lu·∫≠n th√™m v·ªÅ ch·ªß ƒë·ªÅ n√†y trong ph·∫ßn ‚ÄúStoring UTF-8 Encoded Text with Strings‚Äù in Ch∆∞∆°ng 8.

C√°c ki·ªÉu ph·ª©c

Ki·ªÉu ph·ª©c c√≥ th·ªÉ nh√≥m nhi·ªÅu gi√° tr·ªã v√†o chung m·ªôt ki·ªÉu. Rust c√≥ hai ki·ªÉu ph·ª©c ch√≠nh: tuple v√† array.

Ki·ªÉu tuple

M·ªôt ki·ªÉu tuple l√† m·ªôt c√°ch chung ƒë·ªÉ nh√≥m c√°c gi√° tr·ªã kh√°c nhau v√†o l√†m m·ªôt. C√°c tupble c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh: m·ªôt khi ƒë√£ khai b√°o, ch√∫ng s·∫Ω kh√¥ng th·ªÉ tƒÉng hay gi·∫£m k√≠ch c·ª°. Ch√∫ng ta t·∫°o m·ªôt tuble b·∫±ng c√°ch vi·∫øt m·ªôt danh s√°ch c√°c gi√° tr·ªã c√°ch nhau b·ªüi d·∫•u ph·∫©y, bao b·ªçc l·∫°i b·ªüi m·ªôt c·∫∑p ngo·∫∑c tr√≤n. M·ªói v·ªã tr√≠ trong tuble c√≥ m·ªôt ki·ªÉu, v√† c√°c gi√° tr·ªã kh√°c nhau trong m·ªôt tuble kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt ph·∫£i c√πng ki·ªÉu. Ch√∫ng ta c≈©ng ƒë√£ th√™m m·ªôt s·ªë ph·ª• ch√∫ ki·ªÉu trong v√≠ d·ª• sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let tup: (i32, f64, u8) = (500, 6.4, 1);
}

Bi·∫øn tup ƒë·∫°i di·ªán cho to√†n b·ªô tuple, v√¨ m·ªói m·ªôt tuple ƒë∆∞·ª£c coi nh∆∞ m·ªôt bi·∫øn ƒë∆°n. ƒê·ªÉ l·∫•y gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa t·ª´ng th√†nh ph·∫ßn ri√™ng l·∫ª b√™n trong m·ªôt tuple, ch√∫ng ta c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng c√°ch kh·ªõp m·∫´u ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n t√°ch m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã ki·ªÉu tuple, gi·ªëng trong v√≠ d·ª• sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let tup = (500, 6.4, 1);

    let (x, y, z) = tup;

    println!("The value of y is: {y}");
}

Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh n√†y ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n s·∫Ω t·∫°o ra m·ªôt tuple v√† g·∫Øn k·∫øt n√≥ v·ªõi bi·∫øn tup. Sau ƒë√≥ n√≥ d√πng m·ªôt m·∫´u v·ªõi let ƒë·ªÉ l·∫•y ra ba gi√° tr·ªã ri√™ng l·∫ª t·ª´ c√°c th√†nh ph·∫ßn c·ªßa tup, x, y v√† z. Ta g·ªçi qu√° tr√¨nh n√†y l√† ph√° h·ªßy (destructuring), v√¨ n√≥ s·∫Ω t√°ch m·ªôt tuple ƒë∆°n ra th√†nh ba ph·∫ßn ri√™ng bi·ªát. Cu·ªëi c√πng, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh in ra gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa y la 6.4.

Ta c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ truy c·∫≠p tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v√†o m·ªôt th√†nh ph·∫ßn b√™n trong tuple b·∫±ng c√°ch d√πng d·∫•u ch·∫•m (.), theo sau b·ªüi ch·ªâ m·ª•c c·ªßa gi√° tr·ªã m√† b·∫°n mu·ªën ƒë·ªçc hay ghi. V√≠ d·ª•:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let x: (i32, f64, u8) = (500, 6.4, 1);

    let five_hundred = x.0;

    let six_point_four = x.1;

    let one = x.2;
}

Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh n√†y t·∫°o m·ªôt tuple x v√† sau ƒë√≥ truy c·∫≠p v√†o t·ª´ng th√†nh ph·∫ßn c·ªßa tuple th√¥ng qua c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ch·ªâ m·ª•c t∆∞∆°ng ·ª©ng. T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± v·ªõi h·∫ßu h·∫øt ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·∫≠p tr√¨nh kh√°c, ch·ªâ m·ª•c ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n s·∫Ω mang gi√° tr·ªã 0.

M·ªôt tuple m√† kh√¥ng c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã n√†o c√≥ m·ªôt c√°i t√™n ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát, unit. Gi√° tr·ªã n√†y v√† ki·ªÉu t∆∞∆°ng ·ª©ng c·ªßa n√≥ ƒë∆∞·ª£c vi·∫øt l√† () v√† ƒë·∫°i di·ªán cho m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã r·ªóng hay m·ªôt ki·ªÉu tr·∫£ v·ªÅ r·ªóng. C√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c ƒë∆∞·ª£c ng·∫ßm hi·ªÉu l√† tr·∫£ v·ªÅ unit n·∫øu ch√∫ng kh√¥ng tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã n√†o kh√°c.

Ki·ªÉu m·∫£ng (array)

M·ªôt c√°ch kh√°c ƒë·ªÉ khai b√°o m·ªôt bi·∫øn ch·ª©a ƒë∆∞·ª£c nhi·ªÅu gi√° tr·ªã l√† array (m·∫£ng). Kh√¥ng nh∆∞ tuple, c√°c th√†nh ph·∫ßn c·ªßa m·∫£ng ph·∫£i c√≥ c√πng ki·ªÉu. C≈©ng kh√¥ng gi·ªëng m·∫£ng trong nhi·ªÅu ng√¥n ng·ªØ kh√°c, m·∫£ng trong Rust c√≥ chi·ªÅu d√†i c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh.

Ch√∫ng ta vi·∫øt c√°c gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa m·∫£ng nh∆∞ m·ªôt danh s√°ch c√°c gi√° tr·ªã c√°ch nhau b·ªüi d·∫•u ph·∫©y, ƒë∆∞·ª£c bao b·ªçc b·ªüi c·∫∑p d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c vu√¥ng:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let a = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];
}

C√°c m·∫£ng s·∫Ω h·ªØu √≠ch h∆°n khi ch√∫ng ta ph√¢n b·ªë ch√∫ng tr√™n stack thay v√¨ heap (ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω th·∫£o lu·∫≠n v·ªÅ stack v√† heap trong Ch∆∞∆°ng 4) ho·∫∑c khi ch√∫ng ta mu·ªën ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o lu√¥n c√≥ m·ªôt s·ªë ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh. D√π v·∫≠y ki·ªÉu array kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c m·ªÅm d·∫ªo nh∆∞ vector. M·ªôt vector l√† m·ªôt ki·ªÉu t·∫≠p h·ª£p t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± ƒë∆∞·ª£c cung c·∫•p b·ªüi th∆∞ vi·ªán chu·∫©n, v√† n√≥ cho ph√©p thay ƒë·ªïi k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc. N·∫øu b·∫°n kh√¥ng ch·∫Øc n√™n d√πng array hay vector, v·∫≠y th√¨ h√£y d√πng vector. Ch∆∞∆°ng 8 s·∫Ω th·∫£o lu·∫≠n k·ªπ h∆°n v·ªÅ vector.

Tuy nhi√™n, c√°c m·∫£ng s·∫Ω h·ªØu √≠ch h∆°n n·∫øu b·∫°n bi·∫øt s·ªë ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ s·∫Ω kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi. V√≠ d·ª•, n·∫øu b·∫°n mu·ªën l∆∞u danh s√°ch t√™n c√°c th√°ng trong nƒÉm, s·∫Ω t·ªët h∆°n khi d√πng array thay v√¨ vector v√¨ b·∫°n bi·∫øt n√≥ lu√¥n c√≥ 12 ph·∫ßn t·ª≠:

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
let months = ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July",
              "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"];
}

B·∫°n vi·∫øt m·ªôt ki·ªÉu c·ªßa m·∫£ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c·∫∑p d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c vu√¥ng v·ªõi ki·ªÉu c·ªßa m·ªói ph·∫ßn t·ª≠, m·ªôt d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y, v√† s·ªë ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ c·ªßa m·∫£ng, gi·ªëng nh∆∞ sau:

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
let a: [i32; 5] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];
}

·ªû ƒë√¢y, i32 l√† ki·ªÉu c·ªßa m·ªói ph·∫ßn t·ª≠. Sau d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y, s·ªë 5 ch·ªâ ra mang n√†y c√≥ 5 ph·∫ßn t·ª≠.

B·∫°n c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ kh·ªüi t·∫°o m·ªôt m·∫£ng ƒë·ªÉ ch·ª©a c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ c√πng gi√° tr·ªã b·∫±ng c√°ch ch·ªâ ra gi√° tr·ªã ban ƒë·∫ßu, theo sau b·ªüi m·ªôt d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y, v√† sau ƒë√≥ l√† chi·ªÅu dai c·ªßa m·∫£ng, t·∫•t c·∫£ bao trong c·∫∑p d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c vu√¥ng, nh∆∞ v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞·ªõi ƒë√¢y:

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
let a = [3; 5];
}

M·∫£ng t√™n a s·∫Ω ch·ª©a 5 ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ v·ªõi gi√° tr·ªã ban ƒë·∫ßu l√† 3. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y ho√†n to√†n gi·ªëng v·ªõi khi b·∫°n vi·∫øt let a = [3, 3, 3, 3, 3]; nh∆∞ng theo m·ªôt c√°ch ng·∫Øn g·ªçn h∆°n.

Truy c·∫≠p c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ c·ªßa m·∫£ng

M·ªôt m·∫£ng l√† m·ªôt ƒëo·∫°n b·ªô nh·ªõ c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh, x√°c ƒë·ªãnh tr∆∞·ªõc v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c c·∫•p ph√°t tr√™n stack. B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ truy c·∫≠p c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ c·ªßa m·∫£ng d√πng ch·ªâ s·ªë, gi·ªëng nh∆∞ sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let a = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];

    let first = a[0];
    let second = a[1];
}

Trong v√≠ d·ª• n√†y, m·ªôt bi·∫øn c√≥ t√™n first s·∫Ω c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã 1, v√¨ n√≥ l√† gi√° tr·ªã t·∫°i v·ªã tr√≠ [0] trong m·∫£ng. Bi·∫øn c√≥ t√™n second s·∫Ω c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã 2 t·ª´ ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ [1] trong m·∫£ng.

Vi·ªác truy c·∫≠p m·∫£ng kh√¥ng h·ª£p l·ªá

H√£y xem ƒëi·ªÅu g√¨ s·∫Ω x·∫£y ra n·∫øu b·∫°n th·ª≠ truy c·∫≠p v√†o m·ªôt ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ v∆∞·ª£t qu√° ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ cu·ªëi c·ªßa m·∫£ng. Ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code sau, t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± trong tr√≤ ch∆°i ƒëo√°n ch·ªØ trong ch∆∞∆°ng 2, ƒë·ªÉ l·∫•y m·ªôt ch·ªâ m·ª•c t·ª´ ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng:

Filename: src/main.rs

use std::io;

fn main() {
    let a = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];

    println!("Please enter an array index.");

    let mut index = String::new();

    io::stdin()
        .read_line(&mut index)
        .expect("Failed to read line");

    let index: usize = index
        .trim()
        .parse()
        .expect("Index entered was not a number");

    let element = a[index];

    println!("The value of the element at index {index} is: {element}");
}

ƒêo·∫°n code n√†y ƒë∆∞·ª£c d·ªãch th√†nh c√¥ng. N·∫øu b·∫°n ch·∫°y n√≥ b·∫±ng c√°ch d√πng cargo run v√† nh·∫≠p v√†o 0, 1, 2, 3, hay 4, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω in ra gi√° tr·ªã t∆∞∆°ng ·ª©ng t·∫°i v·ªã tr√≠ trong m·∫£ng. N·∫øu b·∫°n nh·∫≠p m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã v∆∞·ª£t qu√° k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc m·∫£ng, ch·∫≥ng h·∫°n 10, b·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y xu·∫•t ra nh∆∞ sau:

thread 'main' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 5 but the index is 10', src/main.rs:19:19
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh sinh ra m·ªôt l·ªói runtime ngay t·∫°i n∆°i m√† ch√∫ng ta d√πng m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã kh√¥ng h·ª£p l·ªá khi d√πng ch·ªâ s·ªë m·∫£ng. Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh k·∫øt th√∫c v·ªõi m·ªôt th√¥ng b√°o l·ªói v√† ƒë√£ kh√¥ng th·ª±c thi ƒë·∫øn c√¢u l·ªánh println! cu·ªëi c√πng. Khi b·∫°n th·ª≠ truy c·∫≠p m·ªôt ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ b·∫±ng c√°ch d√πng ch·ªâ s·ªë, Rust s·∫Ω ki·ªÉm tra xem li·ªáu ch·ªâ s·ªë ƒë√≥ c√≥ nh·ªè h∆°n chi·ªÅu d√†i c·ªßa m·∫£ng hay kh√¥ng. N·∫øu ch·ªâ s·ªë n√†y l·ªõn h∆°n hay b·∫±ng chi·ªÅu d√†i m·∫£ng, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω b·ªã l·ªói v√† k·∫øt th√∫c ngay l·∫≠p t·ª©c (panic). Vi·ªác ki·ªÉm tra n√†y ph·∫£i ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c hi·ªán khi ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y, v√¨ tr√¨nh d·ªãch kh√¥ng th·ªÉ bi·∫øt gi√° tr·ªã m√† ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng s·∫Ω nh·∫≠p v√†o khi ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh sau n√†y.

ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• v·ªÅ c√°c nguy√™n t·∫Øc an to√†n c·ªßa Rust khi ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông. Trong nhi·ªÅu ng√¥n ng·ªØ c·∫•p th·∫•p, vi·ªác ki·ªÉm tra n√†y kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c hi·ªán, v√† khi b·∫°n cung c·∫•p m·ªôt ch·ªâ s·ªë kh√¥ng h·ª£p l·ªá, v√πng b·ªô nh·ªõ kh√¥ng h·ª£p l·ªá s·∫Ω b·ªã truy c·∫≠p. Rust b·∫£o v·ªá b·∫°n kh·ªèi lo·∫°i l·ªói n√†y b·∫±ng c√°ch tho√°t ra ngay l·∫≠p t·ª©c thay v√¨ cho ph√©p truy c·∫≠p v√†o v√πng nh·ªõ v√† ti·∫øp t·ª•c ch·∫°y. Ch∆∞∆°ng 9 s·∫Ω th·∫£o lu·∫≠n th√™m v·ªÅ vi·ªác x·ª≠ l√Ω l·ªói trong Rust, c√°ch vi·∫øt code d·ªÖ ƒë·ªçc, an to√†n v√† tr√°nh c√°c l·ªói panic hay truy c·∫≠p v√πng nh·ªõ kh√¥ng h·ª£p l·ªá.

H√†m - Functions

C√°c h√†m kh√° ph·ªï bi·∫øn trong Rust. B·∫°n ƒë√£ g·∫∑p m·ªôt trong nh·ªØng h√†m quan quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t c·ªßa ng√¥n ng·ªØ: h√†m main, v·ªën l√† ƒëi·ªÉm b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu cho nhi·ªÅu ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh. B·∫°n c≈©ng ƒë√£ th·∫•y t·ª´ kh√≥a fn, v·ªën cho ph√©p b·∫°n khai b√°o c√°c h√†m m·ªõi.

M√£ Rust d√πng snake case nh∆∞ quy ∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫∑t t√™n h√†m v√† bi·∫øn, trong ƒë√≥ t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c k√Ω t·ª± ƒë∆∞·ª£c vi·∫øt ch·ªØ th∆∞·ªùng, c√°c t·ª´ c√°ch nhau b·ªüi d·∫•u g·∫°ch d∆∞·ªõi. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh ch·ª©a m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• v·ªÅ c√°ch khai b√°o h√†m:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");

    another_function();
}

fn another_function() {
    println!("Another function.");
}

Ch√∫ng ta ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a m·ªôt h√†m trong Rust b·∫±ng c√°ch d√πng t·ª´ kh√≥a fn theo sau b·ªüi t√™n h√†m v√† m·ªôt t·∫≠p c√°c d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c tr√≤n. C·∫∑p d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c nh·ªçn theo sau ƒë√≥ ch·ªâ ra v·ªã tr√≠ b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu v√† k·∫øt th√∫c c·ªßa th√¢n h√†m.

Ch√∫ng ta c√≥ th·ªÉ g·ªçi b·∫•t k·ª≥ h√†m n√†o ta ƒë√£ ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a b·∫±ng c√°ch g·ªçi t√™n h√†m, theo sau b·ªüi c·∫∑p d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c tr√≤n. V√¨ another_function ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a trong ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh, n√≥ c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi t·ª´ h√†m main. L∆∞u √Ω l√† ch√∫ng ta ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a another_function sau h√†m main trong file m√£ ngu·ªìn; nh∆∞ng t·∫•t nhi√™n ta c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a n√≥ tr∆∞·ªõc h√†m main. Rust kh√¥ng quan t√¢m b·∫°n ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a h√†m ·ªü ch·ªó n√†o, mi·ªÖn sao b·∫°n vi·∫øt n√≥ trong ph·∫°m vi m√† t·ª´ n∆°i g·ªçi c√≥ th·ªÉ truy c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn ƒë∆∞·ª£c.

H√£y t·∫°o m·ªôt d·ª± √°n c√≥ t√™n functions ƒë·ªÉ kh√°m ph√° th√™m v·ªÅ c√°c h√†m. ƒê·∫∑t h√†m v√≠ d·ª• another_function trong file src/main.rs v√† ch·∫°y n√≥. B·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y n·ªôi dung sau ƒë∆∞·ª£c xu·∫•t ra:

$ cargo run
   Compiling functions v0.1.0 (file:///projects/functions)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.28s
     Running `target/debug/functions`
Hello, world!
Another function.

C√°c d√≤ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c thi theo th·ª© t·ª± ch√∫ng xu·∫•t hi·ªán trong h√†m main. ƒê·∫ßu ti√™n, chu·ªói "Hello, world!" ƒë∆∞·ª£c xu·∫•t ra m√†n h√¨nh, ti·∫øp theo ƒë√≥ another_function ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi v√† n·ªôi dung c·ªßa n√≥ ƒë∆∞·ª£c in ra.

Tham s·ªë

Ch√∫ng ta c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a h√†m v·ªõi c√°c parameters (tham s·ªë), l√† nh·ªØng bi·∫øn ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát nh∆∞ l√† m·ªôt ph·∫ßn c·ªßa ch·ªØ k√Ω c·ªßa h√†m. N·∫øu m·ªôt h√†m c√≥ tham s·ªë, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ cung c·∫•p cho n√≥ c√°c gi√° tr·ªã c·ª• th·ªÉ khi g·ªçi. V·ªÅ m·∫∑t k·ªπ thu·∫≠t, nh·ªØng gi√° tr·ªã c·ª• th·ªÉ m√† b·∫°n cung c·∫•p s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† c√°c argument (ƒë·ªëi s·ªë), tuy nhi√™n trong th·ª±c t·∫ø s·ª≠ d·ª•ng, ch√∫ng ta th∆∞·ªùng d√πng hai t·ª´ n√†y l·∫´n l·ªôn v·ªõi nhau.

Trong phi√™n b·∫£n n√†y c·ªßa another_function ch√∫ng ta th√™m m·ªôt tham s·ªë:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    another_function(5);
}

fn another_function(x: i32) {
    println!("The value of x is: {x}");
}

Khi th·ª≠ ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh; b·∫°n s·∫Ω nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c k·∫øt xu·∫•t sau:

$ cargo run
   Compiling functions v0.1.0 (file:///projects/functions)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1.21s
     Running `target/debug/functions`
The value of x is: 5

Trong ph·∫ßn khai b√°o h√†m another_function ta c√≥ th√™m m·ªôt tham s·ªë ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·∫∑t t√™n x. Ki·ªÉu c·ªßa x l√† i32. Khi truy·ªÅn gi√° tr·ªã 5 cho another_function, macro println! s·∫Ω in ra gi√° tr·ªã 5 ngay t·∫°i v·ªã tr√≠ ch·ª©a x ƒë∆∞·ª£c bao b·ªüi c·∫∑p d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c nh·ªçn trong chu·ªói ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng.

Trong ch·ªØ k√Ω c·ªßa h√†m (th√†nh ph·∫ßn ph√¢n bi·ªát c√°c h√†m v·ªõi nhau), b·∫°n ph·∫£i khai b√°o ki·ªÉu c·ªßa m·ªói tham s·ªë. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·∫©n tr·ªçng trong thi·∫øt k·∫ø c·ªßa Rust: y√™u c·∫ßu khai b√°o ki·ªÉu khi ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a h√†m ƒë·ªìng nghƒ©a v·ªõi vi·ªác tr√¨nh bi√™n d·ªãch s·∫Ω kh√¥ng bao gi·ªù c·∫ßn b·∫°n ph·∫£i d√πng m·ªôt tham s·ªë ƒë·ªÉ c√≥ th·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ƒë∆∞·ª£c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ªßa tham s·ªë ƒë√≥. Tr√¨nh d·ªãch c≈©ng s·∫Ω c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞a ra c√°c th√¥ng b√°o h·ªØu √≠ch h∆°n khi n√≥ bi·∫øt ch√≠nh x√°c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu m√† h√†m ƒë√≥ c·∫ßn.

Khi ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a nhi·ªÅu tham s·ªë, b·∫°n c·∫ßn ph√¢n c√°ch ch√∫ng b·∫±ng d·∫•u ph·∫©y, gi·ªëng nh∆∞ sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    print_labeled_measurement(5, 'h');
}

fn print_labeled_measurement(value: i32, unit_label: char) {
    println!("The measurement is: {value}{unit_label}");
}

V√≠ d·ª• n√†y t·∫°o ra m·ªôt h√†m c√≥ t√™n print_labeled_measurement v·ªõi hai tham s·ªë. Tham s·ªë ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·∫∑t t√™n value v√† l√† m·ªôt i32. Tham s·ªë th·ª© hai c√≥ t√™n unit_label v√† c√≥ ki·ªÉu char. H√†m n√†y sau ƒë√≥ in ra m·ªôt d√≤ng vƒÉn b·∫£n ch·ª©a c·∫£ hai value v√† unit_label.

H√£y th·ª≠ ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code n√†y. Thay th·∫ø ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh src/main.rs hi·ªán c√≥ trong d·ª± √°n functions v·ªõi v√≠ d·ª• ph√≠a tr√™n v√† ch·∫°y d√πng cargo run:

$ cargo run

     Running `target/debug/functions`

V√¨ ch√∫ng ta g·ªçi h√†m v·ªõi 5 nh∆∞ l√† gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa value v√† 'h' l√† gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa unit_label, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω xu·∫•t ra c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ƒë√≥.

C√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu (statement) v√† bi·ªÉu th·ª©c (expression)

Th√¢n h√†m ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·∫°o b·ªüi m·ªôt chu·ªói c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu, v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ k·∫øt th√∫c b·∫±ng m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c. Cho t·ªõi hi·ªán t·∫°i, c√°c h√†m ch√∫ng ta ƒë√£ l√†m qua ch∆∞a bao g·ªìm bi·ªÉu th·ª©c k·∫øt th√∫c, nh∆∞ng b·∫°n c≈©ng ƒë√£ g·∫∑p c√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c l√† m·ªôt ph·∫ßn c·ªßa m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu. V√¨ Rust l√† m·ªôt ng√¥n ng·ªØ d·ª±a tr√™n c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu, ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt s·ª± ph√¢n bi·ªát quan tr·ªçng ƒë·ªÉ hi·ªÉu. C√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ kh√°c kh√¥ng c√≥ s·ª± ph√¢n bi·ªát t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ v·∫≠y, do v·∫≠y ta h√£y c√πng xem qua c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu v√† bi·ªÉu th·ª©c c≈©ng nh∆∞ s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát gi·ªØa ch√∫ng ƒë√£ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn th√¢n c√°c h√†m nh∆∞ th·∫ø n√†o.

Ph√°t bi·ªÉu l√† c√°c c√¢u l·ªánh m√† n√≥ s·∫Ω th·ª±c hi·ªán m·ªôt s·ªë h√†nh ƒë·ªông n√†o ƒë√≥ v√† kh√¥ng tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã. Bi·ªÉu th·ª©c c√≥ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã. H√£y c≈©ng xem qua m·ªôt s·ªë v√≠ d·ª•.

Ch√∫ng ta ƒë√£ t·ª´ng th·ª±c s·ª± d√πng ƒë·∫øn c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu v√† bi·ªÉu th·ª©c. Vi·ªác t·∫°o ra m·ªôt bi·∫øn v√† g√°n m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã cho n√≥ v·ªõi t·ª´ kh√≥a let l√† m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu. Trong Listing 3-1, let y = 6; l√† m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let y = 6;
}

Listing 3-1: M·ªôt h√†m main ƒëang khai b√°o m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu

C√°c khai b√°o h√†m c≈©ng l√† c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu; to√†n b·ªô v√≠ d·ª• tr√™n b·∫£n th√¢n n√≥ c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu.

C√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu kh√¥ng tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã. Do v·∫≠y, b·∫°n kh√¥ng th·ªÉ g√°n m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu let cho m·ªôt bi·∫øn kh√°c, b·∫°n s·∫Ω g·∫∑p l·ªói n·∫øu th·ª≠ l√†m nh∆∞ trong v√≠ d·ª• sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let x = (let y = 6);
}

Khi ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh n√†y, l·ªói b·∫°n g·∫∑p s·∫Ω gi·ªëng nh∆∞ sau:

Ph√°t bi·ªÉu let y = 6 kh√¥ng tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã, do v·∫≠y ch·∫≥ng c√≥ g√¨ ƒë·ªÉ ƒë∆∞a v√†o bi·∫øn x. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y kh√°c v·ªõi c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ kh√°c nh∆∞ C ho·∫∑c Ruby, khi c√°c m·ªôt c√¢u l·ªánh g√°n s·∫Ω tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã b·∫±ng gi√° tr·ªã ƒë∆∞·ª£c g√°n. Trong c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ ƒë√≥, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ vi·∫øt x = y = 6 v√† l√†m cho c·∫£ hai x v√† y mang c√πng gi√° tr·ªã 6; ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng x·∫£y ra trong Rust.

C√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c x√°c ƒë·ªãnh gi√° tr·ªã v√† t·∫°o n√™n h·∫ßu h·∫øt c√°c ƒëo·∫°n l·ªánh b·∫°n vi·∫øt trong Rust. H√£y xem qua m·ªôt ph√©p to√°n, nh∆∞ 5 + 6, ƒë√≥ l√† m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c v√† tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã 11. C√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ l√† m·ªôt ph·∫ßn c·ªßa c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu: Trong Listing 3-1, gi√° tr·ªã 6 trong ph√°t bi·ªÉu let y = 6; l√† m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c v√† tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã 6. Vi·ªác g·ªçi m·ªôt h√†m c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c, g·ªçi m·ªôt macro c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c. M·ªôt kh·ªëi l·ªánh m·ªõi ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·∫°o b·ªüi m·ªôt c·∫∑p ngo·∫∑c nh·ªçn c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c, gi·ªëng nh∆∞ trong v√≠ d·ª• sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

    let y = {
        let x = 3;
        x + 1
    };

    println!("The value of y is: {y}");
}

Bi·ªÉu th·ª©c n√†y:

{
    let x = 3;
    x + 1
}

l√† m·ªôt kh·ªëi l·ªánh, m√† trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã 4. Gi√° tr·ªã n√†y ƒë∆∞·ª£c g√°n v√†o cho y nh∆∞ m·ªôt ph·∫ßn c·ªßa ph√°t bi·ªÉu let. L∆∞u √Ω l√† x + 1 line kh√¥ng c√≥ m·ªôt d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y (;) ·ªü cu·ªëi, kh√¥ng nh∆∞ h·∫ßu h·∫øt c√°c d√≤ng l·ªánh b·∫°n ƒë√£ t·ª´ng th·∫•y. C√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c kh√¥ng c√≥ d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y k·∫øt th√∫c. N·∫øu b·∫°n th√™m d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y, b·∫°n s·∫Ω bi·∫øn n√≥ th√†nh m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu, v√† n√≥ s·∫Ω kh√¥ng tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã. H√£y l∆∞u √Ω ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y khi b·∫°n xem ƒë·∫øn ph·∫ßn k·∫ø ti·∫øp n√≥i v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã v√† bi·ªÉu th·ª©c tr·∫£ v·ªÅ c·ªßa h√†m.

H√†m v·ªõi k·∫øt qu·∫£ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ

C√°c h√†m c√≥ th·ªÉ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ c√°c gi√° tr·ªã cho ƒëo·∫°n code g·ªçi ch√∫ng. Ch√∫ng ta kh√¥ng c·∫ßn ƒë·∫∑t t√™n cho k·∫øt qu·∫£ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ, nh∆∞ng ta ph·∫£i khai b√°o ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ªßa ch√∫ng ph√≠a sau d·∫•u m≈©i t√™n (->). Trong Rust, gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£ v·ªÅ c·ªßa h√†m ƒë·ªìng nghƒ©a v·ªõi gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa bi·ªÉu th·ª©c cu·ªëi c√πng trong th√¢n h√†m. B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng t·ª´ kh√≥a return ƒë·ªÉ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã s·ªõm h∆°n, nh∆∞ng h·∫ßu h·∫øt c√°c h√†m s·∫Ω l·∫•y gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£ v·ªÅ l√† c√¢u l·ªánh cu·ªëi c√πng. Sau ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• v·ªÅ h√†m c√≥ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn five() -> i32 {
    5
}

fn main() {
    let x = five();

    println!("The value of x is: {x}");
}

Kh√¥ng c√≥ c√°c l·ªùi g·ªçi h√†m, macro, hay th·∫≠m ch√≠ ph√°t bi·ªÉu let trong h√†m five ngo√†i ch√≠nh s·ªë 5. ƒê√≥ ho√†n to√†n l√† m·ªôt h√†m h·ª£p l·ªá trong Rust. L∆∞u √Ω l√† ki·ªÉu tr·∫£ v·ªÅ c·ªßa h√†m c≈©ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ch·ªâ ƒë·ªãnh, l√† -> i32. Th·ª≠ ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code; k·∫øt xu·∫•t s·∫Ω gi·ªëng nh∆∞ sau:

$ cargo run
   Compiling functions v0.1.0 (file:///projects/functions)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.30s
     Running `target/debug/functions`
The value of x is: 5

S·ªë 5 trong five l√† gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£ v·ªÅ c·ªßa h√†m, ƒë√≥ l√† l√Ω do v√¨ sao h√†m n√†y ph·∫£i c√≥ ki·ªÉu l√† i32. H√£y xem x√©t m·ªôt c√°ch chi ti·∫øt h∆°n. C√≥ hai th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng: ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n, d√≤ng let x = five(); cho th·∫•y ch√∫ng ta ƒëang d√πng k·∫øt qu·∫£ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ c·ªßa m·ªôt h√†m ƒë·ªÉ kh·ªüi t·∫°o m·ªôt bi·∫øn. V√¨ h√†m five tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã 5, do v·∫≠y d√≤ng l·ªánh ƒë√≥ c≈©ng t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ sau:

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
let x = 5;
}

Th·ª© hai, h√†m five kh√¥ng c√≥ tham s·ªë v√† ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a ki·ªÉu c·ªßa gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£ v·ªÅ, m√† th√¢n h√†m ch·ªâ bao g·ªìm m·ªôt s·ªë 5 kh√¥ng c√≥ d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y, v√¨ ƒë√≥ ch√≠nh l√† bi·ªÉu th·ª©c ch√∫ng ta mu·ªën tr·∫£ v·ªÅ.

H√£y c√πng xem m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• kh√°c:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let x = plus_one(5);

    println!("The value of x is: {x}");
}

fn plus_one(x: i32) -> i32 {
    x + 1
}

Ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code n√†y s·∫Ω in ra The value of x is: 6. Nh∆∞ng n·∫øu ta th√™m m·ªôt d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y v√†o cu·ªëi d√≤ng ch·ª©a x + 1, bi·∫øn n√≥ t·ª´ m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c th√†nh m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c m·ªôt l·ªói.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let x = plus_one(5);

    println!("The value of x is: {x}");
}

fn plus_one(x: i32) -> i32 {
    x + 1;
}

D·ªãch ƒëo·∫°n code sinh ra l·ªói, gi·ªëng nh∆∞ sau:

$ cargo run
   Compiling functions v0.1.0 (file:///projects/functions)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:7:24
  |
7 | fn plus_one(x: i32) -> i32 {
  |    --------            ^^^ expected `i32`, found `()`
  |    |
  |    implicitly returns `()` as its body has no tail or `return` expression
8 |     x + 1;
  |          - help: remove this semicolon

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `functions` due to previous error

Th√¥ng b√°o l·ªói ch√≠nh, mismatched types, cho th·∫•y g·ªëc r·ªÖ v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ c·ªßa ƒëo·∫°n code. ƒê·ªãnh nghƒ©a h√†m plus_one n√≥i r·∫±ng n√≥ s·∫Ω tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt i32, nh∆∞ng c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu l·∫°i kh√¥ng tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã, t∆∞∆°ng ƒë∆∞∆°ng v·ªõi vi·ªác tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã r·ªóng (). Do kh√¥ng c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã n√†o ƒë∆∞·ª£c tr·∫£ v·ªÅ, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y tr√°i ng∆∞·ª£c v·ªõi ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a c·ªßa h√†m v√† g√¢y ra l·ªói. Trong k·∫øt xu·∫•t n√†y, Rust c≈©ng cung c·∫•p th√™m m·ªôt th√¥ng b√°o c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p s·ª≠a ƒë∆∞·ª£c l·ªói: n√≥ ƒë·ªÅ xu·∫•t vi·ªác x√≥a d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y, v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè ƒë∆∞·ª£c l·ªói.

Ghi ch√∫

T·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c l·∫≠p tr√¨nh vi√™n khi vi·∫øt code ƒë·ªÅu c·ªë g·∫Øng vi·∫øt sao cho d·ªÖ hi·ªÉu, nh∆∞ng ƒë√¥i khi v·∫´n c·∫ßn c√°c ƒëo·∫°n gi·∫£i th√≠ch th√™m. Trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p ƒëo, h·ªç s·∫Ω ƒë·ªÉ l·∫°i c√°c ghi ch√∫ trong m√£ ngu·ªìn, c√°c ghi ch√∫ n√†y s·∫Ω b·ªã b·ªè qua b·ªüi tr√¨nh bi√™n d·ªãch nh∆∞ng s·∫Ω h·ªØu √≠ch cho ng∆∞·ªùi ƒë·ªçc code.

ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt ghi ch√∫ ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n:

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
// hello, world
}

Trong Rust, c√°c ghi ch√∫ b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu b·∫±ng c·∫∑p d·∫•u slash (//), v√† k√Ω hi·ªáu ghi ch√∫ ƒë√≥ s·∫Ω c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã cho ƒë·∫øn h·∫øt d√≤ng. V·ªõi nh·ªØng ghi ch√∫ tr√™n nhi·ªÅu h√†ng, b·∫°n s·∫Ω c·∫ßn bao g·ªìm // tr√™n t·ª´ng d√≤ng ghi ch√∫.

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
// ·ªû ƒë√¢y ch√∫ng ta ƒëang l√†m m·ªôt s·ªë ƒëi·ªÅu ph·ª©c t·∫°p, d√†i ƒë·ªß ƒë·ªÉ ta ph·∫£i c·∫ßn nhi·ªÅu 
// d√≤ng ghi ch√∫ ƒë·ªÉ ho√†n th√†nh! Whew! Hi v·ªçng l√† ghi ch√∫ n√†y s·∫Ω gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c 
// v·ªÅ nh·ªØng ƒëi·ªÅu ƒëang di·ªÖn ra.
}

Ghi ch√∫ c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·∫∑t ·ªü cu·ªëi d√≤ng code:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let lucky_number = 7; // I‚Äôm feeling lucky today
}

Nh∆∞ng b·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y ch√∫ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c d√πng ·ªü d·∫°ng sau th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n h∆°n, v·ªõi ghi ch√∫ tr√™n m·ªôt d√≤ng ri√™ng bi·ªát ph√≠a tr√™n ƒëo·∫°n code n√≥ ƒëang gi·∫£i th√≠ch:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    // I‚Äôm feeling lucky today
    let lucky_number = 7;
}

Rust c≈©ng c√≥ m·ªôt ki·ªÉu ghi ch√∫ kh√°c, ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† c√°c ghi ch√∫ t√†i li·ªáu, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω th·∫£o lu·∫≠n th√™m trong ph·∫ßn ‚ÄúPublishing a Crate to Crates.io‚Äù ·ªü ch∆∞∆°ng 14.

C√°c kh·ªëi ƒëi·ªÅu khi·ªÉn

Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ch·∫°y m·ªôt s·ªë ƒëo·∫°n l·ªánh d·ª±a khi m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán n√†o ƒë√≥ l√† true, ho·∫∑c ch·∫°y l·∫∑p l·∫°i m·ªôt l·ªánh khi m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán n√†o ƒë√≥ l√† true, l√† c√°c kh·ªëi ƒëi·ªÅu khi·ªÉn c∆° b·∫£n c√≥ trong h·∫ßu h·∫øt c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·∫≠p tr√¨nh. Kh·ªëi ƒëi·ªÅu khi·ªÉn ph·ªï bi·∫øn nh·∫•t cho ph√©p b·∫°n ki·ªÉm so√°t vi·ªác th·ª±c thi c√°c ƒëo·∫°n code trong Rust l√† c√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if v√† c√°c l·ªánh l·∫∑p.

Bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if

M·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if cho ph√©p b·∫°n r·∫Ω nh√°nh th·ª±c thi d·ª±a tr√™n c√°c ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán n√†o ƒë√≥. B·∫°n cung c·∫•p m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán v√† ph√°t bi·ªÉu: "N·∫øu ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán n√†y ƒë√∫ng, h√£y ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n l·ªánh n√†y. N·∫øu kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t, ƒë·ª´ng ch·∫°y n√≥".

T·∫°o m·ªôt d·ª± √°n m·ªõi ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† branches trong th∆∞ m·ª•c projects ƒë·ªÉ kh·∫£o s√°t bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if. Trong file src/main.rs, h√£y nh·∫≠p v√†o n·ªôi dung sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let number = 3;

    if number < 5 {
        println!("condition was true");
    } else {
        println!("condition was false");
    }
}

T·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c ph√°t bi·ªÉu if s·∫Ω b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu b·∫±ng t·ª´ kh√≥a if, theo sau b·ªüi m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán. Trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y, ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán l√† ki·ªÉm tra xem li·ªáu bi·∫øn number c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã nh·ªè h∆°n 5 hay kh√¥ng. Ch√∫ng ta ƒë·∫∑t kh·ªëi l·ªánh ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c thi n·∫øu ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán l√† ƒë√∫ng ngay sau d·∫•u ngo·∫∑c ƒë√≥ng c·ªßa ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán. C√°c kh·ªëi l·ªánh k·∫øt h·ª£p v·ªõi if ƒë√¥i khi ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† arm, gi·ªëng nh∆∞ arms trong ph√°t bi·ªÉu match m√† ta ƒë√£ th·∫£o lu·∫≠n trong ph·∫ßn ‚ÄúComparing the Guess to the Secret Number‚Äù section of Chapter 2.

Ch√∫ng ta c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ t√πy ch·ªçn th√™m m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu else, gi·ªëng nh∆∞ ch√∫ng ta ƒë√£ l√†m ·ªü ƒë√¢y, ƒë·ªÉ cung c·∫•p m·ªôt ƒëo·∫°n code m√† s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c thi n·∫øu ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã false. N·∫øu b·∫°n kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p else, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω ch·ªâ ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n b·ªè qua kh·ªëi l·ªánh if v√† ti·∫øp t·ª•c th·ª±c thi c√°c l·ªánh ti·∫øp sau ƒë√≥.

Th·ª≠ ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n l·ªánh n√†y, b·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y k·∫øt xu·∫•t nh∆∞ sau:

$ cargo run
   Compiling branches v0.1.0 (file:///projects/branches)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.31s
     Running `target/debug/branches`
condition was true

H√£y th·ª≠ thay ƒë·ªïi number sang m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã l√†m cho ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán tr·∫£ v·ªÅ k·∫øt qu·∫£ false ƒë·ªÉ xem ƒëi·ªÅu g√¨ x·∫£y ra:

fn main() {
    let number = 7;

    if number < 5 {
        println!("condition was true");
    } else {
        println!("condition was false");
    }
}

Ch·∫°y l·∫°i ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh, v√† xem k·∫øt xu·∫•t:

$ cargo run
   Compiling branches v0.1.0 (file:///projects/branches)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.31s
     Running `target/debug/branches`
condition was false

M·ªôt ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn l∆∞u √Ω l√† ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán trong ƒëo·∫°n code n√†y b·∫Øt bu·ªôc ph·∫£i c√≥ ki·ªÉu bool. N·∫øu ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán n√†y kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† bool, b·∫°n s·∫Ω nh·∫≠n m·ªôt l·ªói. V√≠ d·ª•, th·ª≠ ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n l·ªánh sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let number = 3;

    if number {
        println!("number was three");
    }
}

Trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y bi·ªÉu th·ª©c trong if tr·∫£ v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã 3, v√† Rust ph√°t ra m·ªôt l·ªói:

$ cargo run
   Compiling branches v0.1.0 (file:///projects/branches)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:8
  |
4 |     if number {
  |        ^^^^^^ expected `bool`, found integer

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `branches` due to previous error

L·ªói n√†y ch·ªâ ra Rust c·∫ßn m·ªôt bool nh∆∞ng l·∫°i nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c m·ªôt integer. Kh√¥ng nh∆∞ c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ nh∆∞ Ruby hay JavaScript, Rust kh√¥ng t·ª± ƒë·ªông th·ª≠ chuy·ªÉn c√°c gi√° tr·ªã kh√¥ng ph·∫£i boolean sang boolean. N·∫øu b·∫°n mu·ªën ƒëo·∫°n if ch·ªâ ch·∫°y khi m·ªôt s·ªë b·∫±ng v·ªõi 0, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ vi·∫øt l·∫°i nh∆∞ sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let number = 3;

    if number != 0 {
        println!("number was something other than zero");
    }
}

Ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code n√†y s·∫Ω tr·∫£ v·ªÅ k·∫øt xu·∫•t sau: number was something other than zero.

X·ª≠ l√Ω nhi·ªÅu ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán v·ªõi else if

B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng nhi·ªÅu ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán kh√°c nhau b·∫±ng c√°ch k·∫øt h·ª£p if v·ªõi else trong m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c else if. V√≠ d·ª•:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let number = 6;

    if number % 4 == 0 {
        println!("number is divisible by 4");
    } else if number % 3 == 0 {
        println!("number is divisible by 3");
    } else if number % 2 == 0 {
        println!("number is divisible by 2");
    } else {
        println!("number is not divisible by 4, 3, or 2");
    }
}

Ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh n√†y c√≥ b·ªën nh√°nh c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c thi. Sau khi ch·∫°y b·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y k·∫øt xu·∫•t sau:

$ cargo run
   Compiling branches v0.1.0 (file:///projects/branches)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.31s
     Running `target/debug/branches`
number is divisible by 3

Khi ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh n√†y, n√≥ s·∫Ω ki·ªÉm tra l·∫ßn l∆∞·ª£t m·ªói bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if v√† th·ª±c thi th√¢n if ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n m√† bi·ªÉu th·ª©c tr·∫£ v·ªÅ true. L∆∞u √Ω r·∫±ng tuy 6 chia h·∫øt cho 2, ch√∫ng ta v·∫´n kh√¥ng th·∫•y c√¢u number is divisible by 2 ƒë∆∞·ª£c in ra, c≈©ng nh∆∞ kh√¥ng th·∫•y c√¢u number is not divisible by 4, 3, or 2 trong kh·ªëi else. ƒê√≥ l√† v√¨ Rust ch·ªâ th·ª±c thi ƒëo·∫°n l·ªánh trong th√¢n if ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n m√† n√≥ th·∫•y tr·∫£ v·ªÅ true, v√† m·ªôt khi t√¨m th·∫•y, n√≥ s·∫Ω th·∫≠m ch√≠ kh√¥ng ki·ªÉm tra c√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c ph√≠a sau.

S·ª≠ d·ª•ng qu√° nhi·ªÅu else if l√†m cho code c·ªßa b·∫°n l·ªôn x·ªôn, do v·∫≠y n·∫øu b·∫°n c√≥ nhi·ªÅu h∆°n m·ªôt, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ s·∫Ω c·∫ßn refactor code. Ch∆∞∆°ng 6 m√¥ t·∫£ m·ªôt c·∫•u tr√∫c r·∫Ω nh√°nh m·∫°nh m·∫Ω trong Rust ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† match ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y.

S·ª≠ d·ª•ng if b√™n trong ph√°t bi·ªÉu let

V√¨ if l√† m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c, v·∫≠y n√™n ta c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng n√≥ b√™n ph·∫£i c·ªßa m·ªôt ph√°t bi·ªÉu let ƒë·ªÉ g√°n gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£ v·ªÅ cho m·ªôt bi·∫øn, nh∆∞ trong Listing 3-2.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let condition = true;
    let number = if condition { 5 } else { 6 };

    println!("The value of number is: {number}");
}

Listing 3-2: G√°n k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if v√†o m·ªôt bi·∫øn

Bi·∫øn number s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c g√°n m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã d·ª±a tr√™n k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m·ªôt bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if. Ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code sau ƒë·ªÉ xem ƒëi·ªÅu g√¨ x·∫£y ra:

$ cargo run
   Compiling branches v0.1.0 (file:///projects/branches)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.30s
     Running `target/debug/branches`
The value of number is: 5

H√£y nh·ªõ l√† c√°c kh·ªëi l·ªánh s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªãnh gi√° tr·ªã b·∫±ng v·ªõi gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa bi·ªÉu th·ª©c cu·ªëi c√πng b√™n trong n√≥, v√† b·∫£n th√¢n c√°c con s·ªë c≈©ng l√† c√°c bi·ªÉu th·ª©c. Trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y, gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa to√†n b·ªô bi·ªÉu th·ª©c if ph·ª• thu·ªôc v√†o nh√°nh n√†o ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c thi. C√≥ nghƒ©a l√† c√°c nh√°nh c·ªßa if ph·∫£i c√≥ c√πng ki·ªÉu; trong Listing 3-2, k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa c·∫£ hai nh√°nh c·ªßa if ƒë·ªÅu c√≥ ki·ªÉu s·ªë nguy√™n i32. N·∫øu c√°c ki·ªÉu kh√¥ng kh·ªõp nhau, nh∆∞ trong v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞·ªõi ƒë√¢y, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω nh·∫≠n v·ªÅ m·ªôt l·ªói.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let condition = true;

    let number = if condition { 5 } else { "six" };

    println!("The value of number is: {number}");
}

Khi ch√∫ng ta th·ª≠ d·ªãch ƒëo·∫°n code n√†y, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω nh·∫≠n v·ªÅ m·ªôt l·ªói. C√°c nh√°nh if v√† else c√≥ c√°c ki·ªÉu kh√¥ng t∆∞∆°ng th√≠ch, v√† Rust ch·ªâ ra ch√≠nh x√°c v·ªã tr√≠ n∆°i ph√°t sinh l·ªói trong ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh:

$ cargo run
   Compiling branches v0.1.0 (file:///projects/branches)
error[E0308]: `if` and `else` have incompatible types
 --> src/main.rs:4:44
  |
4 |     let number = if condition { 5 } else { "six" };
  |                                 -          ^^^^^ expected integer, found `&str`
  |                                 |
  |                                 expected because of this

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `branches` due to previous error

Bi·ªÉu th·ª©c trong kh·ªëi if tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã integer, trong khi bi·ªÉu th·ª©c trong kh·ªëi else tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt string. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng th·ªÉ ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông ƒë∆∞·ª£c v√¨ c√°c bi·∫øn ch·ªâ c√≥ th·ªÉ c√≥ m·ªôt ki·ªÉu duy nh·∫•t, v√† Rust c·∫ßn bi·∫øt ki·ªÉu c·ªßa bi·∫øn number l√† g√¨ ngay khi d·ªãch. Vi·ªác bi·∫øt ki·ªÉu c·ªßa bi·∫øn number cho ph√©p tr√¨nh d·ªãch x√°c ƒë·ªãnh t√≠nh h·ª£p l·ªá v·ªÅ ki·ªÉu b·∫•t c·ª© khi n√†o ta truy xu·∫•t ƒë·∫øn n√≥. Rust s·∫Ω kh√¥ng th·ªÉ l√†m ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y n·∫øu n√≥ ch·ªâ c√≥ th·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ki·ªÉu c·ªßa number v√†o l√∫c ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh; tr√¨nh d·ªãch c√≥ l·∫Ω s·∫Ω ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n nhi·ªÅu c≈©ng nh∆∞ kh√≥ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o v·ªÅ ƒëo·∫°n code h∆°n n·∫øu n√≥ ph·∫£i l∆∞u gi·ªØ th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu gi·∫£ t∆∞·ªüng cho b·∫•t k·ª≥ bi·∫øn n√†o.

S·ª≠ d·ª•ng v√≤ng l·∫∑p (loops)

Ch√∫ng ta th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n ph·∫£i th·ª±c thi m·ªôt ƒëo·∫°n code n√†o ƒë√≥ nhi·ªÅu l·∫ßn. ƒê·ªÉ l√†m ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y, Rust cung c·∫•p m·ªôt s·ªë d·∫°ng v√≤ng l·∫∑p, n√≥ cho ph√©p ch·∫°y ƒë·∫øn cu·ªëi ƒëo·∫°n code b√™n trong th√¢n v√≤ng l·∫∑p , sau ƒë√≥ quay tr·ªü l·∫°i v·ªã tr√≠ b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu. ƒê·ªÉ tr·∫£i nghi·ªám th·ª≠ c√°c v√≤ng l·∫∑p, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω c√πng t·∫°o m·ªôt d·ª± √°n m·ªõi c√≥ t√™n loops.

Rust c√≥ ba d·∫°ng l·∫∑p: loop, while, v√† for. H√£y c√πng th·ª≠ qua t·ª´ng c√°i.

L·∫∑p l·∫°i m·ªôt ƒëo·∫°n code s·ª≠ d·ª•ng loop

T·ª´ kh√≥a loop s·∫Ω y√™u c·∫ßu Rust th·ª±c thi m·ªôt ƒëo·∫°n code l·∫∑p ƒëi l·∫∑p l·∫°i cho ƒë·∫øn khi b·∫°n y√™u c·∫ßu n√≥ k·∫øt th√∫c.

ƒê·ªÉ v√≠ d·ª•, h√£y thay ƒë·ªïi file src/main.rs trong th∆∞ m·ª•c loops c·ªßa b·∫°n ƒë·ªÉ n√≥ tr√¥ng nh∆∞ sau:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    loop {
        println!("again!");
    }
}

Khi ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh n√†y, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω th·∫•y d√≤ng again! ƒë∆∞·ª£c in l√™n m√†n h√¨nh li√™n t·ª•c cho ƒë·∫øn khi b·∫°n ng·ª´ng ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh. H·∫ßu h·∫øt c√°c terminal h·ªó tr·ª£ t·ªï h·ª£p ph√≠m ctrl-c ƒë·ªÉ ng·∫Øt m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh ƒëang b·ªã k·∫πt trong m·ªôt v√≤ng l·∫∑p. H√£y c√πng ch·∫°y th·ª≠:

$ cargo run
   Compiling loops v0.1.0 (file:///projects/loops)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.29s
     Running `target/debug/loops`
again!
again!
again!
again!
^Cagain!

K√Ω hi·ªáu ^C ƒë·∫°i di·ªán cho v·ªã tr√≠ b·∫°n nh·∫•n ctrl-c . B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ nh√¨n th·∫•y d√≤ng again! ƒë∆∞·ª£c in ph√≠a sau ^C ho·∫∑c kh√¥ng, ph·ª• thu·ªôc v√†o n∆°i ƒëo·∫°n code ƒëang th·ª±c thi b√™n trong v√≤ng l·∫∑p khi n√≥ nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c t√≠n hi·ªáu ng·∫Øt.

May m·∫Øn l√† Rust c≈©ng cung c·∫•p m·ªôt c√°ch ƒë·ªÉ tho√°t kh·ªèi v√≤ng l·∫∑p b·∫±ng code. B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë·∫∑t m·ªôt t·ª´ kh√≥a break b√™n trong v√≤ng l·∫∑p ƒë·ªÉ n√≥i v·ªõi ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh khi n√†o c·∫ßn tho√°t kh·ªèi v√≤ng l·∫∑p. H√£y nh·ªõ l·∫°i ch√∫ng ta ƒë√£ l√†m ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y trong ‚ÄúQuitting After a Correct Guess‚Äù trong ch∆∞∆°ng 2 ƒë·ªÉ tho√°t kh·ªèi ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh khi ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng chi·∫øn th·∫Øng b·∫±ng c√°ch ƒëo√°n ƒë√∫ng con s·ªë.

Ch√∫ng ta c≈©ng d√πng continue trong tr√≤ ch∆°i ƒëo√°n s·ªë, ƒë·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh b·ªè qua ph·∫ßn c√≤n l·∫°i trong th√¢n v√≤ng l·∫∑p hi·ªán t·∫°i v√† b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu m·ªôt v√≤ng l·∫∑p m·ªõi.

Tr·∫£ k·∫øt qu·∫£ v·ªÅ t·ª´ v√≤ng l·∫∑p

M·ªôt trong nh·ªØng l√Ω do d√πng loop l√† ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c thi l·∫°i m·ªôt t√°c v·ª• n√†o ƒë√≥ b·∫°n bi·∫øt c√≥ th·ªÉ s·∫Ω th·∫•t b·∫°i, ki·ªÉu nh∆∞ khi ki·ªÉm tra xem m·ªôt thread ƒë√£ ho√†n th√†nh c√¥ng vi·ªác hay ch∆∞a. B·∫°n c≈©ng c·∫ßn tr·∫£ v·ªÅ k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa t√°c v·ª• ƒë√≥ cho ph·∫ßn c√≤n l·∫°i c·ªßa ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh khi k·∫øt th√∫c v√≤ng l·∫∑p. ƒê·ªÉ l√†m ƒëi·ªÉu n√†y b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ th√™m gi√° tr·ªã mu·ªën tr·∫£ v·ªÅ sau ph√°t bi·ªÉu break m√† b·∫°n d√πng ƒë·ªÉ k·∫øt th√∫c v√≤ng l·∫∑p; gi√° tr·ªã ƒë√≥ s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c tr·∫£ v·ªÅ ra ngo√†i v√≤ng l·∫∑p v√† b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng ƒë∆∞·ª£c n√≥ nh∆∞ trong v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞·ªõi ƒë√¢y:

fn main() {
    let mut counter = 0;

    let result = loop {
        counter += 1;

        if counter == 10 {
            break counter * 2;
        }
    };

    println!("The result is {result}");
}

Tr∆∞·ªõc khi l·∫∑p, b·∫°n khai b√°o m·ªôt bi·∫øn t√™n counter v√† kh·ªüi t·∫°o gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa n√≥ l√† 0. Sau ƒë√≥ b·∫°n khai b√°o ti·∫øp m·ªôt bi·∫øn t√™n l√† result ƒë·ªÉ l∆∞u l·∫°i gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£ v·ªÅ t·ª´ v√≤ng l·∫∑p. C·ª© m·ªói l·∫ßn l·∫∑p ta l·∫°i c·ªông th√™m 1 v√†o bi·∫øn counter v√† ki·ªÉm tra gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa counter v·ªõi 10, khi ƒëi·ªÉu n√†y x·∫£y ra, ta d√πng t·ª´ kh√≥a break v·ªõi gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£ v·ªÅ l√† counter * 2. Sau v√≤ng l·∫∑p, ta d√πng m·ªôt d·∫•u ch·∫•m ph·∫©y ƒë·ªÉ k·∫øt th√∫c ph√°t bi·ªÉu g√°n gi√° tr·ªã v√†o cho result. Cu·ªëi c√πng, ta in ra gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa result`, trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y s·∫Ω l√† 20.

G√°n nh√£n ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n bi·ªát gi·ªØa c√°c v√≤ng l·∫∑p

N·∫øu b·∫°n c√≥ nhi·ªÅu v√≤ng l·∫∑p l·ªìng nhau, break v√† continue ƒë∆∞·ª£c √°p d·ª•ng cho v√≤ng l·∫∑p b√™n trong nh·∫•t t·∫°i n∆°i b·∫°n g·ªçi. B·∫°n c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë·∫∑t nh√£n cho m·ªôt v√≤ng l·∫∑p ƒë·ªÉ sau ƒë√≥ khi g·ªçi break ho·∫∑c continue, ta c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ªâ ra ch√≠nh x√°c ta mu·ªën √°p d·ª•ng nh·ªØng t·ª´ kh√≥a ƒë√≥ cho v√≤ng l·∫∑p ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c g√°n nh√£n thay v√¨ v√≤ng l·∫∑p trong c√πng. C√°c nh√£n v√≤ng l·∫∑p ph·∫£i b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu v·ªõi m·ªôt d·∫•u nh√°y ƒë∆°n. Sau ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• v·ªÅ hai v√≤ng l·∫∑p l·ªìng nhau:

fn main() {
    let mut count = 0;
    'counting_up: loop {
        println!("count = {count}");
        let mut remaining = 10;

        loop {
            println!("remaining = {remaining}");
            if remaining == 9 {
                break;
            }
            if count == 2 {
                break 'counting_up;
            }
            remaining -= 1;
        }

        count += 1;
    }
    println!("End count = {count}");
}

V√≤ng l·∫∑p b√™n ngo√†i c√≥ nh√£n 'counting_up, v√† n√≥ s·∫Ω ƒë·∫øm t·ª´ 0 ƒë·∫øn 2. V√≤ng l·∫∑p b√™n trong kh√¥ng c√≥ nh√£n v√† ƒë·∫øm ng∆∞·ª£c t·ª´ 10 xu·ªëng 9. Ph√°t bi·ªÉu break ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n kh√¥ng ch·ªâ ra nh√£n n√™n ch·ªâ tho√°t ra kh·ªèi v√≤ng l·∫∑p b√™n trong. Trong khi ƒë√≥, ph√°t bi·ªÉu break 'counting_up; s·∫Ω tho√°t ra v√≤ng l·∫∑p b√™n ngo√†i. ƒêo·∫°n code n√†y s·∫Ω in ra:

$ cargo run
   Compiling loops v0.1.0 (file:///projects/loops)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.58s
     Running `target/debug/loops`
count = 0

count = 1
remaining = 10

count = 2
remaining = 10
End count = 2

L·∫∑p theo ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán v·ªõi while

M·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω th∆∞·ªùng ph·∫£i ki·ªÉm tra ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán b√™n trong m·ªôt v√≤ng l·∫∑p. Khi ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán l√† true, ti·∫øp t·ª•c v√≤ng l·∫∑p. Khi ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán kh√¥ng c√≤n l√† true, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω g·ªçi break v√† ng∆∞ng v√≤ng l·∫∑p. B·∫°n ho√†n to√†n c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m nh·ªØng ƒëi·ªÅu tr√™n b·∫±ng vi·ªác k·∫øt h·ª£p loop, if, else v√† break; b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª≠ ngay n·∫øu mu·ªën. Tuy nhi√™n, c·∫•u tr√∫c n√†y r·∫•t ph·ªï bi·∫øn, do v·∫≠y Rust t·∫°o ra m·ªôt c·∫•u tr√∫c l·∫∑p ri√™ng cho n√≥, g·ªçi v√≤ng l·∫∑p while. Trong Listing 3-3, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω d√πng while ƒë·ªÉ l·∫∑p ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh 3 l·∫ßn, ƒë·∫øm ng∆∞·ª£c m·ªói l·∫ßn l·∫∑p, in ra m·ªôt th√¥ng b√°o v√† k·∫øt th√∫c sau khi ho√†n th√†nh v√≤ng l·∫∑p.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let mut number = 3;

    while number != 0 {
        println!("{number}!");

        number -= 1;
    }

    println!("LIFTOFF!!!");
}

Listing 3-3: D√πng m·ªôt v√≤ng l·∫∑p while ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y code trong khi m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán v·∫´n c√≤n ƒë√∫ng

V√≤ng l·∫∑p n√†y cho ph√©p lo·∫°i b·ªè nhi·ªÅu c·∫•u tr√∫c l·ªìng nhau nh∆∞ khi b·∫°n k·∫øt h·ª£p loop, if, else, v√† break, gi√∫p code c·ªßa b·∫°n s√°ng s·ªßa h∆°n. Trong khi m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán v·∫´n l√† true, ch·∫°y v√≤ng l·∫∑p; ng∆∞·ª£c l·∫°i, k·∫øt th√∫c v√≤ng l·∫∑p.

L·∫∑p qua m·ªôt t·∫≠p h·ª£p v·ªõi for

B·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·ªçn d√πng while ƒë·ªÉ duy·ªát qua c√°c th√†nh ph·∫ßn c·ªßa m·ªôt t·∫≠p h·ª£p, ki·ªÉu nh∆∞ m·ªôt m·∫£ng. V√≠ d·ª•, v√≤ng l·∫∑p trong Listing 3-4 in ra c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ c√≥ trong m·∫£ng a.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let a = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50];
    let mut index = 0;

    while index < 5 {
        println!("the value is: {}", a[index]);

        index += 1;
    }
}

Listing 3-4: L·∫∑p qua t·ª´ng ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ trong m·ªôt t·∫≠p h·ª£p s·ª≠ d·ª•ng v√≤ng l·∫∑p while

·ªû ƒë√¢y, ƒëo·∫°n code ƒë·∫øm qua c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ c√≥ trong m·∫£ng. N√≥ b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu t·ª´ ch·ªâ s·ªë 0, v√† ti·∫øp t·ª•c l·∫∑p cho ƒë·∫øn khi g·∫∑p ch·ªâ s·ªë cu·ªëi c√πng c·ªßa m·∫£ng (l√† khi index < 5 kh√¥ng c√≤n tr·∫£ v·ªÅ true). Ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code n√†y s·∫Ω in ra t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ trong m·∫£ng:

$ cargo run

T·∫•t c·∫£ nƒÉm gi√° tr·ªã trong m·∫£ng ƒë·ªÅu ƒë∆∞·ª£c xu·∫•t ra c·ª≠a s·ªï ch·∫°y ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh. M·∫∑c d√π index s·∫Ω ƒë·∫°t gi√° tr·ªã 5 v√†o m·ªôt th·ªùi ƒëi·ªÉm n√†o ƒë√≥, v√≤ng l·∫∑p s·∫Ω ng·ª´ng th·ª±c thi tr∆∞·ªõc khi c·ªë l·∫•y gi√° tr·ªã th·ª© s√°u (kh√¥ng t·ªìn t·∫°i) t·ª´ m·∫£ng.

Tuy nhi√™n, c√°c ti·∫øp c·∫≠n n√†y ·∫©n ch·ª©a l·ªói; ch√∫ng ta c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh v·ªÅ tr·∫°ng th√°i panic n·∫øu gi√° tr·ªã ch·ªâ s·ªë hay ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán l·∫∑p kh√¥ng ch√≠nh x√°c. V√≠ d·ª•, n·∫øu b·∫°n thay ƒë·ªïi ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a m·∫£ng a th√†nh m·ªôt m·∫£ng ch·ªâ c√≥ b·ªën ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ nh∆∞ng l·∫°i qu√™n thay ƒë·ªïi ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán th√†nh while index < 4, ƒëo·∫°n code s·∫Ω b·ªã l·ªói. V√† n√≥ c≈©ng ch·∫°y ch·∫≠m b·ªüi tr√¨nh d·ªãch ph·∫£i th√™m code ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra m·ªói l·∫ßn l·∫∑p xem ch·ªâ s·ªë c√≥ n·∫±m trong ph·∫°m vi h·ª£p l·ªá hay kh√¥ng.

Nh∆∞ m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ch√≠nh x√°c h∆°n, b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng m·ªôt v√≤ng for v√† th·ª±c thi code cho m·ªói ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ trong t·∫≠p h·ª£p. M·ªôt v√≤ng l·∫∑p for s·∫Ω tr√¥ng nh∆∞ ƒëo·∫°n code trong Listing 3-5.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let a = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50];

    for element in a {
        println!("the value is: {element}");
    }
}

Listing 3-5: Looping through each element of a collection using a for loop

Khi ch·∫°y ƒëo·∫°n code n√†y, b·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y c√πng k·∫øt xu·∫•t nh∆∞ trong Listing 3-4. Quan tr·ªçng h∆°n, gi·ªù ƒë·ªô an to√†n c·ªßa code cao h∆°n v√† lo·∫°i b·ªè c∆° h·ªôi ph√°t sinh bug khi c·ªë truy c·∫≠p m·ªôt ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ v∆∞·ª£t ra ngo√†i ph·∫°m vi c·ªßa m·∫£ng.

S·ª≠ d·ª•ng v√≤ng for, b·∫°n c≈©ng kh√¥ng c·∫ßn ph·∫£i nh·ªõ thay ƒë·ªïi c√°c ƒëo·∫°n code kh√°c n·∫øu b·∫°n thay ƒë·ªïi s·ªë gi√° tr·ªã c√≥ trong m·∫£ng, nh∆∞ c√°ch b·∫°n c·∫ßn l√†m n·∫øu s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°ch th·ª©c trong Listing 3-4.

S·ª± an to√†n v√† ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa c√°c v√≤ng for l√†m cho ch√∫ng tr·ªü th√†nh c·∫•u tr√∫c l·∫∑p ph·ªï bi·∫øn nh·∫•t trong Rust. Ngay c·∫£ khi b·∫°n mu·ªën ch·∫°y m·ªôt s·ªë code m·ªôt s·ªë l·∫ßn nh·∫•t ƒë·ªãnh, gi·ªëng trong v√≠ d·ª• ƒë·∫øm ng∆∞·ª£c m√† ch√∫ng ta d√πng v√≤ng l·∫∑p whiletrong Listing 3-3, h·∫ßu h·∫øt Rustaceans s·∫Ω ch·ªçn d√πng for. ƒê·ªÉ l√†m ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y ta c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng m·ªôt Range, v·ªën ƒë∆∞·ª£c cung c·∫•p b·ªüi th∆∞ vi·ªán chu·∫©n, v√† s·∫Ω t·∫°o ra t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c con s·ªë tu·∫ßn t·ª± b·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu t·ª´ m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã v√† k·∫øt th√∫c tr∆∞·ªõc m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã kh√°c.

ƒê√¢y l√† v√≠ d·ª• countdown ƒë∆∞·ª£c vi·∫øt l·∫°i d√πng v√≤ng for v√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng th·ª©c kh√°c ta ch∆∞a nh·∫Øc ƒë·∫øn, rev, ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫£o ng∆∞·ª£c Range:

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    for number in (1..4).rev() {
        println!("{number}!");
    }
    println!("LIFTOFF!!!");
}

ƒêo·∫°n code n√†y tr√¥ng r√µ r√†ng s√°ng s·ªßa h∆°n ph·∫£i kh√¥ng?

T·ªïng k·∫øt

B·∫°n ƒë√£ l√†m ƒë∆∞·ª£c! ƒê√¢y th·∫≠t l√† m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng v·ªõi r·∫•t nhi·ªÅu th√¥ng tin: b·∫°n h·ªçc v·ªÅ bi·∫øn, c√°c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu v√¥ h∆∞·ªõng v√† k·∫øt h·ª£p, h√†m, ghi ch√∫, ph√°t bi·ªÉu if, v√† c·∫£ c√°c v√≤ng l·∫∑p! ƒê·ªÉ th·ª±c h√†nh v·ªõi c√°c kh√°i ni·ªám ƒë∆∞·ª£c gi·ªõi thi·ªáu trong ch∆∞∆°ng n√†y, h√£y th·ª≠ vi·∫øt m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh l√†m nh·ªØng vi·ªác sau:

  • Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi nhi·ªát ƒë·ªô gi·ªØa c√°c h·ªá Fahrenheit v√† Celsius.
  • T·∫°o s·ªë Fibonacci th·ª© n.
  • In ra l·ªùi b√†i h√°t ‚ÄúThe Twelve Days of Christmas‚Äù, ·ª©ng d·ª•ng c√°c v√≤ng l·∫∑p ƒë·ªÉ in ra nh·ªØng ƒëo·∫°n l·∫∑p l·∫°i trong b√†i h√°t.

Khi b·∫°n ƒë√£ s·∫µn s√†ng ƒë·ªÉ ti·∫øp t·ª•c, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω n√≥i v·ªÅ m·ªôt kh√°i ni·ªám kh√¥ng t·ªìn t·∫°i trong h·∫ßu h·∫øt c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ kh√°c: ownership.

T√¨m hi·ªÉu v·ªÅ Ownership (t√≠nh s·ªü h·ªØu)

Ownership l√† t√≠nh nƒÉng ƒë·ªôc ƒë√°o nh·∫•t c√≥ trong Rust v√† c√≥ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng s√¢u r·ªông ƒë·∫øn nh·ªØng ph·∫ßn kh√°c c·ªßa ng√¥n ng·ªØ. N√≥ cho ph√©p Rust ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o an to√†n khi truy c·∫≠p v√†o b·ªô nh·ªõ m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn ƒë·∫øn tr√¨nh d·ªçn r√°c, do v·∫≠y vi·ªác hi·ªÉu r√µ v·ªÅ ownership l√† r·∫•t quan tr·ªçng. Trong ch∆∞∆°ng n√†y, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω n√≥i v·ªÅ ownership c≈©ng nh∆∞ m·ªôt v√†i ƒë·∫∑c t√≠nh li√™n quan: borrowing, slide, v√† c√°ch Rust s·∫Øp x·∫øp d·ªØ li·ªáu trong b·ªô nh·ªõ.

Ownership (t√≠nh s·ªü h·ªØu) l√† g√¨?

Ownership l√† m·ªôt t·∫≠p c√°c quy t·∫Øc ph·ªëi h·ª£p v·ªõi nhau, ƒë·ªãnh h√¨nh c√°ch Rust qu·∫£n l√Ω b·ªô nh·ªõ. T·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh ƒë·ªÅu ph·∫£i qu·∫£n l√Ω c√°ch ch√∫ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng b·ªô nh·ªõ m√°y t√≠nh khi ch·∫°y. M·ªôt s·ªë ng√¥n ng·ªØ c√≥ b·ªô d·ªçn r√°c ch·∫°y ƒë·ªãnh k·ª≥ ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i ph√≥ng c√°c ph·∫ßn b·ªô nh·ªõ kh√¥ng c√≤n ƒë∆∞·ª£c d√πng t·ªõi; trong c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ kh√°c, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh ph·∫£i xin c·∫•p ph√°t ho·∫∑c gi·∫£i ph√≥ng b·ªô nh·ªõ m·ªôt c√°ch c·ª• th·ªÉ. Rust d√πng c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n th·ª© ba: b·ªô nh·ªõ ƒë∆∞·ª£c qu·∫£n l√Ω th√¥ng qua m·ªôt h·ªá th·ªëng s·ªü h·ªØu v·ªõi m·ªôt t·∫≠p c√°c quy t·∫Øc s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c ki·ªÉm tra b·ªüi tr√¨nh bi√™n d·ªãch. N·∫øu b·∫•t k·ª≥ quy t·∫Øc n√†o b·ªã vi ph·∫°m, ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh s·∫Ω kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c d·ªãch. Kh√¥ng c√≥ b·∫•t k·ª≥ t√≠nh nƒÉng n√†o c·ªßa ownership l√†m ch·∫≠m ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh c·ªßa b·∫°n khi ch·∫°y.

V√¨ ownership l√† m·ªôt kh√°i ni·ªám m·ªõi v·ªõi nhi·ªÅu l·∫≠p tr√¨nh vi√™n, n√≥ s·∫Ω m·∫•t m·ªôt th·ªùi gian ƒë·ªÉ l√†m quen. Tin t·ªët l√† c√†ng c√≥ nhi·ªÅu kinh nghi·ªám v·ªõi Rust v√† c√°c quy t·∫Øc c·ªßa h·ªá th·ªëng ownership, b·∫°n c√†ng th·∫•y vi·ªác l·∫≠p tr√¨nh c√°c code an to√†n v√† hi·ªáu qu·∫£ d·ªÖ d√†ng h∆°n. V·∫≠y n√™n h√£y c·ªë l√™n!

Khi ƒë√£ hi·ªÉu ownership, b·∫°n s·∫Ω c√≥ m·ªôt n·ªÅn t·∫£ng ch·∫Øc ch·∫Øn ƒë·ªÉ hi·ªÉu c√°c t√≠nh nƒÉng v·ªën l√†m cho Rust tr·ªü n√™n ƒë·ªôc nh·∫•t. Trong ch∆∞∆°ng n√†y b·∫°n s·∫Ω h·ªçc v·ªÅ ownership th√¥ng qua m·ªôt s·ªë v√≠ d·ª• t·∫≠p trung v√†o m·ªôt c·∫•u tr√∫c d·ªØ li·ªáu r·∫•t ph·ªï bi·∫øn: string.

Stack v√† Heap

Nhi·ªÅu ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·∫≠p tr√¨nh kh√¥ng y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ph·∫£i nghƒ© v·ªÅ stack v√† heap th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n. Nh∆∞ng v·ªõi m·ªôt ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·∫≠p tr√¨nh h·ªá th·ªëng nh∆∞ Rust, vi·ªác m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr√™n stack hay tr√™n heap ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng t·ªõi c√°ch ng√¥n ng·ªØ x·ª≠ l√Ω c≈©ng nh∆∞ l√Ω do b·∫°n quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh. C√°c ph·∫ßn c·ªßa ownership s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√¥ t·∫£ trong m·ªëi quan h·ªá v·ªõi stack v√† heap ·ªü ph·∫ßn sau c·ªßa ch∆∞∆°ng n√†y, ·ªü ƒë√¢y ch·ªâ l√† m·ªôt gi·∫£i th√≠ch ng·∫Øn g·ªçn ƒë·ªÉ chu·∫©n b·ªã.

C·∫£ hai stack v√† heap ƒë·ªÅu l√† c√°c ph·∫ßn c·ªßa b·ªô nh·ªõ m√† ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh c·ªßa b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng khi ch·∫°y, nh∆∞ng ch√∫ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·ªï ch·ª©c theo nh·ªØng c√°ch kh√°c nhau. Stack l∆∞u tr·ªØ c√°c gi√° tr·ªã theo th·ª© t·ª± b·∫°n ƒë∆∞a v√†o v√† l·∫•y c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ra theo th·ª© t·ª± ng∆∞·ª£c l·∫°i. Ta th∆∞·ªùng g·ªçi l√† last in, first out. H√£y t∆∞·ªüng t∆∞·ª£ng m·ªôt ch·ªìng ƒëƒ©a: khi b·∫°n th√™m ƒëƒ©a, b·∫°n s·∫Ω ƒë·∫∑t ch√∫ng l√™n tr√™n c√πng, v√† khi c·∫ßn l·∫•y m·ªôt c√°i ƒëƒ©a, b·∫°n s·∫Ω l·∫•y c√°i tr√™n nh·∫•t. B·∫°n s·∫Ω kh√¥ng b·ªè v√†o ho·∫∑c l·∫•y ra c√°c ƒëƒ©a ·ªü gi·ªØa hay b√™n d∆∞·ªõi c√πng. Th√™m d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† ƒë·∫©y (push) v√† stack, v√† thao t√°c l·∫•y ra ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† l·∫•y ra kh·ªèi stack (pop). T·∫•t c·∫£ d·ªØ li·ªáu l∆∞u tr√™n stack ph·∫£i c√≥ m·ªôt ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh cho tr∆∞·ªõc. D·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc kh√¥ng th·ªÉ bi·∫øt tr∆∞·ªõc khi bi√™n d·ªãch ho·∫∑c c√≥ th·ªÉ thay ƒë·ªïi ph·∫£i ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr√™n heap.

Heap ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·ªï ch·ª©c √≠t quy c·ªß h∆°n: khi b·∫°n ƒë∆∞a d·ªØ li·ªáu l√™n heap, b·∫°n y√™u c·∫ßu m·ªôt kh√¥ng gian tr·ªëng c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc c·ª• th·ªÉ. B·ªô ph√¢n ph·ªëi b·ªô nh·ªõ s·∫Ω t√¨m m·ªôt ph·∫ßn tr·ªëng tr√™n heap ƒë·ªß l·ªõn ƒë·ªÉ ch·ª©a, ƒë√°nh d·∫•u n√≥ ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c d√πng, v√† tr·∫£ v·ªÅ m·ªôt con tr·ªè (pointer), ch·ª©a ƒë·ªãa ch·ªâ c·ªßa v·ªã tr√≠ ph·∫ßn b·ªô nh·ªõ v·ª´a ƒë∆∞·ª£c c·∫•p ph√°t. Qu√° tr√¨nh n√†y ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† ph√¢n ph·ªëi b·ªô nh·ªõ tr√™n heap v√† ƒë√¥i khi ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi ng·∫Øn g·ªçn l√† ph√¢n ph·ªëi b·ªô nh·ªõ (ƒë·∫©y m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã v√†o stack kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c coi l√† ph√¢n ph·ªëi b·ªô nh·ªõ). V√¨ con tr·ªè ch·ª©a ƒë·ªãa ch·ªâ v√πng nh·ªõ c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh v√† bi·∫øt tr∆∞·ªõc, n√≥ c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u trong stack, nh∆∞ng khi b·∫°n c·∫ßn l·∫•y d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ª±c s·ª±, b·∫°n s·∫Ω c·∫ßn ƒëi theo ƒë·ªãa ch·ªâ ch·ª©a trong con tr·ªè. H√£y t∆∞·ªüng t∆∞·ª£ng khi ƒë·∫øn m·ªôt nh√† h√†ng, b·∫°n cho nh√¢n vi√™n bi·∫øt s·ªë ng∆∞·ªùi trong nh√≥m, h·ªç s·∫Ω t√¨m m·ªôt b√†n tr·ªëng ƒë·ªß cho nh√≥m c·ªßa b·∫°n v√† d·∫´n b·∫°n ƒë·∫øn ƒë√≥. N·∫øu m·ªôt ng∆∞·ªùi trong nh√≥m ƒë·∫øn mu·ªôn, h·ªç c√≥ th·ªÉ h·ªèi n∆°i b·∫°n ng·ªìi ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m b·∫°n.

ƒê·∫©y m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã v√†o stack nhanh h∆°n ph√¢n ph·ªëi tr√™n heap v√¨ tr√¨nh qu·∫£n l√Ω kh√¥ng c·∫ßn t√¨m m·ªôt n∆°i ƒë·ªÉ l∆∞u d·ªØ li·ªáu; v·ªã tr√≠ ƒë√≥ lu√¥n n·∫±m tr√™n ƒë·ªânh c·ªßa stack. Trong khi ƒë√≥, ph√¢n ph·ªëi b·ªô nh·ªõ tr√™n heap c·∫ßn nhi·ªÅu thao t√°c h∆°n v√¨ tr√¨nh qu·∫£n l√Ω ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n ph·∫£i t√¨m m·ªôt kh√¥ng gian tr·ªëng ƒë·ªß l·ªõn ƒë·ªÉ ch·ª©a d·ªØ li·ªáu, sau ƒë√≥ l√†m c√°c thao t√°c ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh d·∫•u vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng kh√¥ng gian nh·ªõ ƒë√≥.

Truy c·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu tr√™n heap c≈©ng ch·∫≠m h∆°n trong stack v√¨ b·∫°n ph·∫£i theo m·ªôt con tr·ªè ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫øn ƒë√∫ng n∆°i. C√°c b·ªô x·ª≠ l√Ω hi·ªán nay s·∫Ω ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông nhanh h∆°n n·∫øu ch√∫ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i truy c·∫≠p b·ªô nh·ªõ nhi·ªÅu. Ti·∫øp t·ª•c v·ªõi v√≠ d·ª• ·ªü tr√™n, h√£y t∆∞·ªüng t∆∞·ª£ng m·ªôt ng∆∞·ªùi ph·ª•c v·ª• ·ªü nh√† h√†ng ph·∫£i nh·∫≠n ƒë·∫∑t m√≥n t·ª´ nhi·ªÅu b√†n kh√°c nhau. C√°ch l√†m hi·ªáu qu·∫£ nh·∫•t l√† nh·∫≠n t·∫•t c·∫£ y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·∫∑t m√≥n t·ª´ m·ªôt b√†n tr∆∞·ªõc khi di chuy·ªÉn ƒë·∫øn b√†n ti·∫øp theo. Nh·∫≠n m√≥n t·ª´ b√†n A, r·ªìi sang b√†n B, sau ƒë√≥ quay l·∫°i b√†n A, r·ªìi ti·∫øp t·ª•c quay l·∫°i b√†n B c√≥ l·∫Ω s·∫Ω ch·∫≠m h∆°n nhi·ªÅu. Theo c√πng c√°ch, m·ªôt b·ªô x·ª≠ l√Ω c√≥ th·ªÉ ho√†n th√†nh c√¥ng vi·ªác t·ªët h∆°n n·∫øu n√≥ l√†m vi·ªác v·ªõi c√°c d·ªØ li·ªáu n·∫±m g·∫ßn nhau (gi·ªëng nh∆∞ trong stack) h∆°n l√† khi ch√∫ng n·∫±m xa nhau (nh∆∞ v·ªõi heap).

Khi code c·ªßa b·∫°n g·ªçi m·ªôt h√†m, c√°c gi√° tr·ªã truy·ªÅn v√†o cho h√†m ƒë√≥ (c√≥ th·ªÉ bao g·ªìm c·∫£ c√°c con tr·ªè l√™n heap) v√† c√°c bi·∫øn c·ª•c b·ªô c·ªßa h√†m ƒë·ªÅu ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·∫©y v√†o stack. Khi h√†m k·∫øt th√∫c, c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ƒë√≥ s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c l·∫•y ra kh·ªèi stack.

Theo d√µi ph·∫ßn code n√†o code ƒëang d√πng nh·ªØng ph·∫ßn n√†o c·ªßa heap, t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a vi·ªác tr√πng l·∫Øp d·ªØ li·ªáu, v√† d·ªçn d·∫πp nh·ªØng d·ªØ li·ªáu n√†o kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c d√πng t·ªõi tr√™n heap sao cho ch√∫ng ta kh√¥ng c·∫°n ki·ªát c√°c t√†i nguy√™n b·ªô nh·ªõ l√† nh·ªØng v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ m√† ownership nh·∫Øm ƒë·∫øn. M·ªôt khi ƒë√£ hi·ªÉu v·ªÅ ownership, b·∫°n s·∫Ω kh√¥ng c·∫ßn nghƒ© v·ªÅ stack v√† heap th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n n·ªØa, nh∆∞ng bi·∫øt m·ª•c ƒë√≠ch ch√≠nh c·ªßa ownership l√† ƒë·ªÉ qu·∫£n l√Ω b·ªô nh·ªõ heap c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£i th√≠ch v√¨ sao n√≥ l√†m vi·ªác theo c√°ch m√† b·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y.

C√°c quy t·∫Øc c·ªßa Ownership

ƒê·∫ßu ti√™n, h√£y xem qua c√°c quy t·∫Øc c·ªßa ownership. H√£y ghi nh·ªõ c√°c quy t·∫Øc n√†y khi ta ƒëi qua c√°c v√≠ ƒë·ª• minh h·ªça:

  • M·ªói gi√° tr·ªã trong Rust c√≥ m·ªôt ch·ªß s·ªü h·ªØu (owner)
  • M·ªói th·ªùi ƒëi·ªÉm ch·ªâ c√≥ duy nh·∫•t m·ªôt owner.
  • Khi owner ra kh·ªèi ph·∫°m vi (scope, t·∫ßm v·ª±c c·ªßa bi·∫øn) c·ªßa n√≥, gi√° tr·ªã s·∫Ω b·ªã h·ªßy.

T·∫ßm v·ª±c c·ªßa bi·∫øn

Gi·ªù ta ƒë√£ ho√†n th√†nh c√∫ ph√°p c∆° b·∫£n c·ªßa Rust, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω kh√¥ng c·∫ßn th√™m fn main() { v√†o c√°c v√≠ d·ª•, do v·∫≠y n·∫øu mu·ªën ch·∫°y th·ª≠ h√£y t·ª± th√™m ch√∫ng v√†o trong h√†m main. Khi vi·∫øt c√°c v√≠ d·ª• theo c√°ch ng·∫Øn g·ªçn nh∆∞ v·∫≠y, ch√∫ng ta c√≥ th·ªÉ t·∫≠p trung v√†o chi ti·∫øt mu·ªën n√≥i h∆°n l√† c√°c ƒëo·∫°n code m·∫´u.

V√≠ d·ª• ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n v·ªÅ ownership, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω xem qua t·∫ßm v·ª±c (scope) c·ªßa m·ªôt s·ªë bi·∫øn. M·ªôt t·∫ßm v·ª±c l√† m·ªôt ƒëo·∫°n trong m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh m√† trong ƒë√≥ m·ªôt th√†nh ph·∫ßn n√†o ƒë√≥ l√† h·ª£p l·ªá. H√£y xem qua v√≠ d·ª• sau:

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
let s = "hello";
}

Bi·∫øn s tham chi·∫øu ƒë·∫øn m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã chu·ªói, gi√° tr·ªã n√†y ƒë∆∞·ª£c hard code v√†o trong ph·∫ßn text c·ªßa ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh. C√°c bi·∫øn l√† h·ª£p l·ªá t·∫°i th·ªùi ƒëi·ªÉm ch√∫ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c khai b√°o cho ƒë·∫øn h·∫øt t·∫ßm v·ª±c hi·ªán t·∫°i. Listing 4-1 tr√¨nh b√†y m·ªôt ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh v·ªõi c√°c ghi ch√∫ ch·ªâ ra n∆°i bi·∫øn s l√† h·ª£p l·ªá.

fn main() {
    {                      // s is not valid here, it‚Äôs not yet declared
        let s = "hello";   // s is valid from this point forward

        // do stuff with s
    }                      // this scope is now over, and s is no longer valid
}

Listing 4-1: M·ªôt bi·∫øn v√† t·∫ßm v·ª±c (ph·∫°m vi) c·ªßa n√≥

N√≥i c√°ch kh√°c, c√≥ hai th·ªùi ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng ·ªü ƒë√¢y:

  • Khi s ƒëi v√†o trong t·∫ßm v·ª±c, n√≥ tr·ªü n√™n h·ª£p l·ªá.
  • s s·∫Ω v·∫´n h·ª£p l·ªá cho ƒë·∫øn khi n√≥ ƒëi ra kh·ªèi t·∫ßm v·ª±c.

T·∫°i ƒëi·ªÉm n√†y, m·ªëi quan h·ªá gi·ªØa c√°c t·∫ßm v·ª±c v√† khi c√°c bi·∫øn l√† h·ª£p l·ªá ho√†n to√†n t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± trong c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·∫≠p tr√¨nh kh√°c. Gi·ªù ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω √°p d·ª•ng ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y v·ªõi ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu String ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m hi·ªÉu s√¢u h∆°n.

Ki·ªÉu String

ƒê·ªÉ minh h·ªça c√°c quy t·∫Øc c·ªßa ownership, ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω c·∫ßn m·ªôt ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n nh·ªØng ki·ªÉu ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c n√≥i ƒë·∫øn trong ph·∫ßn ‚ÄúC√°c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu‚Äù ·ªü ch∆∞∆°ng 3. Nh·ªØng ki·ªÉu ƒë∆∞·ª£c n√≥i ƒë·∫øn trong ph·∫ßn ƒë√≥ c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc c·ªë ƒë·ªãnh, c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u trong stack v√† d·ªÖ d√†ng l·∫•y ra khi ƒëi ra kh·ªèi ph·∫°m vi c·ªßa n√≥, c≈©ng nh∆∞ c√≥ th·ªÉ t·∫°o m·ªôt b·∫£n sao m·ªõi ƒë·ªôc l·∫≠p v·ªõi b·∫£n g·ªëc n·∫øu m·ªôt ph·∫ßn kh√°c c·ªßa ch∆∞∆°ng tr√¨nh mu·ªën ƒë·ªçc gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa n√≥. Nh∆∞ng ch√∫ng ta mu·ªën xem c√°ch d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr√™n heap v√† kh√°m ph√° c√°ch Rust bi·∫øt khi n√†o c·∫ßn gi·∫£i ph√≥ng d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë√≥, trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y String l√† m·ªôt v√≠ d·ª• tuy·ªát v·ªùi.

Ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω t·∫≠p trung tr√™n c√°c ph·∫ßn c·ªßa String c√≥ li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn t√≠nh s·ªü h·ªØu (ownership). Nh∆∞ng nh·ªØng ph·∫ßn n√†y c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ √°p d·ª•ng l√™n c√°c ki·ªÉu d·ªØ li·ªáu ph·ª©c t·∫°p kh√°c, bao g·ªìm c·∫£ c√°c ki·ªÉu trong th∆∞ vi·ªán chu·∫©n v√† c√°c ki·ªÉu do b·∫°n t·ª± t·∫°o. Ch√∫ng ta s·∫Ω n√≥i s√¢u h∆°n v·ªÅ String trong Ch∆∞∆°ng 8.

We‚Äôve already seen string literals, where a string value is hardcoded into our program. String literals are convenient, but they aren‚Äôt suitable for every situation in which we may want to use text. One reason is that they‚Äôre immutable. Another is that not every string value can be known when we write our code: for example, what if we want to take user input and store it? For these situations, Rust has a second string type, String. This type manages data allocated on the heap and as such is able to store an amount of text that is unknown to us at compile time. You can create a String from a string literal using the from function, like so:

#![allow(unused)]
fn main() {
let s = String::from("hello");
}

The double colon :: operator allows us to namespace this particular from function under the String type rather than using some sort of name like string_from. We‚Äôll discuss this syntax more in the ‚ÄúMethod Syntax‚Äù section of Chapter 5, and when we talk about namespacing with modules in ‚ÄúPaths for Referring to an Item in the Module Tree‚Äù in Chapter 7.

This kind of string can be mutated:

fn main() {
    let mut s = String::from("hello");

    s.push_str(", world!"); // push_str() appends a literal to a String

    println!("{}", s); // This will print `hello, world!`
}

So, what‚Äôs the difference here? Why can String be mutated but literals cannot? The difference is in how these two types deal with memory.

Memory and Allocation

In the case of a string literal, we know the contents at compile time, so the text is hardcoded directly into the final executable. This is why string literals are fast and efficient. But these properties only come from the string literal‚Äôs immutability. Unfortunately, we can‚Äôt put a blob of memory into the binary for each piece of text whose size is unknown at compile time and whose size might change while running the program.

With the String type, in order to support a mutable, growable piece of text, we need to allocate an amount of memory on the heap, unknown at compile time, to hold the contents. This means:

  • The memory must be requested from the memory allocator at runtime.
  • We need a way of returning this memory to the allocator when we‚Äôre done with our String.

That first part is done by us: when we call String::from, its implementation requests the memory it needs. This is pretty much universal in programming languages.

However, the second part is different. In languages with a garbage collector (GC), the GC keeps track of and cleans up memory that isn‚Äôt being used anymore, and we don‚Äôt need to think about it. In most languages without a GC, it‚Äôs our responsibility to identify when memory is no longer being used and to call code to explicitly free it, just as we did to request it. Doing this correctly has historically been a difficult programming problem. If we forget, we‚Äôll waste memory. If we do it too early, we‚Äôll have an invalid variable. If we do it twice, that‚Äôs a bug too. We need to pair exactly one allocate with exactly one free.

Rust takes a different path: the memory is automatically returned once the variable that owns it goes out of scope. Here‚Äôs a version of our scope example from Listing 4-1 using a String instead of a string literal:

fn main() {
    {
        let s = String::from("hello"); // s is valid from this point forward

        // do stuff with s
    }                                  // this scope is now over, and s is no
                                       // longer valid
}

There is a natural point at which we can return the memory our String needs to the allocator: when s goes out of scope. When a variable goes out of scope, Rust calls a special function for us. This function is called drop, and it‚Äôs where the author of String can put the code to return the memory. Rust calls drop automatically at the closing curly bracket.

Note: In C++, this pattern of deallocating resources at the end of an item‚Äôs lifetime is sometimes called Resource Acquisition Is Initialization (RAII). The drop function in Rust will be familiar to you if you‚Äôve used RAII patterns.

This pattern has a profound impact on the way Rust code is written. It may seem simple right now, but the behavior of code can be unexpected in more complicated situations when we want to have multiple variables use the data we‚Äôve allocated on the heap. Let‚Äôs explore some of those situations now.

Variables and Data Interacting with Move

Multiple variables can interact with the same data in different ways in Rust. Let‚Äôs look at an example using an integer in Listing 4-2.

fn main() {
    let x = 5;
    let y = x;
}

Listing 4-2: Assigning the integer value of variable x to y

We can probably guess what this is doing: ‚Äúbind the value 5 to x; then make a copy of the value in x and bind it to y.‚Äù We now have two variables, x and y, and both equal 5. This is indeed what is happening, because integers are simple values with a known, fixed size, and these two 5 values are pushed onto the stack.

Now let‚Äôs look at the String version:

fn main() {
    let s1 = String::from("hello");
    let s2 = s1;
}

This looks very similar, so we might assume that the way it works would be the same: that is, the second line would make a copy of the value in s1 and bind it to s2. But this isn‚Äôt quite what happens.

Take a look at Figure 4-1 to see what is happening to String under the covers. A String is made up of three parts, shown on the left: a pointer to the memory that holds the contents of the string, a length, and a capacity. This group of data is stored on the stack. On the right is the memory on the heap that holds the contents.

Figure 4-1: Representation in memory of a String holding the value "hello" bound to s1

The length is how much memory, in bytes, the contents of the String are currently using. The capacity is the total amount of memory, in bytes, that the String has received from the allocator. The difference between length and capacity matters, but not in this context, so for now, it‚Äôs fine to ignore the capacity.

When we assign s1 to s2, the String data is copied, meaning we copy the pointer, the length, and the capacity that are on the stack. We do not copy the data on the heap that the pointer refers to. In other words, the data representation in memory looks like Figure 4-2.

Figure 4-2: Representation in memory of the variable s2 that has a copy of the pointer, length, and capacity of s1

The representation does not look like Figure 4-3, which is what memory would look like if Rust instead copied the heap data as well. If Rust did this, the operation s2 = s1 could be very expensive in terms of runtime performance if the data on the heap were large.

Figure 4-3: Another possibility for what s2 = s1 might do if Rust copied the heap data as well

Earlier, we said that when a variable goes out of scope, Rust automatically calls the drop function and cleans up the heap memory for that variable. But Figure 4-2 shows both data pointers pointing to the same location. This is a problem: when s2 and s1 go out of scope, they will both try to free the same memory. This is known as a double free error and is one of the memory safety bugs we mentioned previously. Freeing memory twice can lead to memory corruption, which can potentially lead to security vulnerabilities.

To ensure memory safety, after the line let s2 = s1;, Rust considers s1 as no longer valid. Therefore, Rust doesn‚Äôt need to free anything when s1 goes out of scope. Check out what happens when you try to use s1 after s2 is created; it won‚Äôt work:

fn main() {
    let s1 = String::from("hello");
    let s2 = s1;

    println!("{}, world!", s1);
}

You‚Äôll get an error like this because Rust prevents you from using the invalidated reference:

$ cargo run
   Compiling ownership v0.1.0 (file:///projects/ownership)
error[E0382]: borrow of moved value: `s1`
 --> src/main.rs:5:28
  |
2 |     let s1 = String::from("hello");
  |         -- move occurs because `s1` has type `String`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
3 |     let s2 = s1;
  |              -- value moved here
4 |
5 |     println!("{}, world!", s1);
  |                            ^^ value borrowed here after move
  |
  = note: this error originates in the macro `$crate::format_args_nl` which comes from the expansion of the macro `println` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0382`.
error: could not compile `ownership` due to previous error

If you‚Äôve heard the terms shallow copy and deep copy while working with other languages, the concept of copying the pointer, length, and capacity without copying the data probably sounds like making a shallow copy. But because Rust also invalidates the first variable, instead of being called a shallow copy, it‚Äôs known as a move. In this example, we would say that s1 was moved into s2. So, what actually happens is shown in Figure 4-4.

Figure 4-4: Representation in memory after s1 has been invalidated

That solves our problem! With only s2 valid, when it goes out of scope it alone will free the memory, and we‚Äôre done.

In addition, there‚Äôs a design choice that‚Äôs implied by this: Rust will never automatically create ‚Äúdeep‚Äù copies of your data. Therefore, any automatic copying can be assumed to be inexpensive in terms of runtime performance.

Variables and Data Interacting with Clone

If we do want to deeply copy the heap data of the String, not just the stack data, we can use a common method called clone. We‚Äôll discuss method syntax in Chapter 5, but because methods are a common feature in many programming languages, you‚Äôve probably seen them before.

Here‚Äôs an example of the clone method in action:

fn main() {
    let s1 = String::from("hello");
    let s2 = s1.clone();

    println!("s1 = {}, s2 = {}", s1, s2);
}

This works just fine and explicitly produces the behavior shown in Figure 4-3, where the heap data does get copied.

When you see a call to clone, you know that some arbitrary code is being executed and that code may be expensive. It‚Äôs a visual indicator that something different is going on.

Stack-Only Data: Copy

There‚Äôs another wrinkle we haven‚Äôt talked about yet. This code using integers‚Äîpart of which was shown in Listing 4-2‚Äîworks and is valid:

fn main() {
    let x = 5;
    let y = x;

    println!("x = {}, y = {}", x, y);
}

But this code seems to contradict what we just learned: we don‚Äôt have a call to clone, but x is still valid and wasn‚Äôt moved into y.

The reason is that types such as integers that have a known size at compile time are stored entirely on the stack, so copies of the actual values are quick to make. That means there‚Äôs no reason we would want to prevent x from being valid after we create the variable y. In other words, there‚Äôs no difference between deep and shallow copying here, so calling clone wouldn‚Äôt do anything different from the usual shallow copying, and we can leave it out.

Rust has a special annotation called the Copy trait that we can place on types that are stored on the stack, as integers are (we‚Äôll talk more about traits in Chapter 10). If a type implements the Copy trait, variables that use it do not move, but rather are trivially copied, making them still valid after assignment to another variable.

Rust won‚Äôt let us annotate a type with Copy if the type, or any of its parts, has implemented the Drop trait. If the type needs something special to happen when the value goes out of scope and we add the Copy annotation to that type, we‚Äôll get a compile-time error. To learn about how to add the Copy annotation to your type to implement the trait, see ‚ÄúDerivable Traits‚Äù in Appendix C.

So, what types implement the Copy trait? You can check the documentation for the given type to be sure, but as a general rule, any group of simple scalar values can implement Copy, and nothing that requires allocation or is some form of resource can implement Copy. Here are some of the types that implement Copy:

  • All the integer types, such as u32.
  • The Boolean type, bool, with values true and false.
  • All the floating-point types, such as f64.
  • The character type, char.
  • Tuples, if they only contain types that also implement Copy. For example, (i32, i32) implements Copy, but (i32, String) does not.

Ownership and Functions

The mechanics of passing a value to a function are similar to those when assigning a value to a variable. Passing a variable to a function will move or copy, just as assignment does. Listing 4-3 has an example with some annotations showing where variables go into and out of scope.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let s = String::from("hello");  // s comes into scope

    takes_ownership(s);             // s's value moves into the function...
                                    // ... and so is no longer valid here

    let x = 5;                      // x comes into scope

    makes_copy(x);                  // x would move into the function,
                                    // but i32 is Copy, so it's okay to still
                                    // use x afterward

} // Here, x goes out of scope, then s. But because s's value was moved, nothing
  // special happens.

fn takes_ownership(some_string: String) { // some_string comes into scope
    println!("{}", some_string);
} // Here, some_string goes out of scope and `drop` is called. The backing
  // memory is freed.

fn makes_copy(some_integer: i32) { // some_integer comes into scope
    println!("{}", some_integer);
} // Here, some_integer goes out of scope. Nothing special happens.

Listing 4-3: Functions with ownership and scope annotated

If we tried to use s after the call to takes_ownership, Rust would throw a compile-time error. These static checks protect us from mistakes. Try adding code to main that uses s and x to see where you can use them and where the ownership rules prevent you from doing so.

Return Values and Scope

Returning values can also transfer ownership. Listing 4-4 shows an example of a function that returns some value, with similar annotations as those in Listing 4-3.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
    let s1 = gives_ownership();         // gives_ownership moves its return
                                        // value into s1

    let s2 = String::from("hello");     // s2 comes into scope

    let s3 = takes_and_gives_back(s2);  // s2 is moved into
                                        // takes_and_gives_back, which also
                                        // moves its return value into s3
} // Here, s3 goes out of scope and is dropped. s2 was moved, so nothing
  // happens. s1 goes out of scope and is dropped.

fn gives_ownership() -> String {             // gives_ownership will move its
                                             // return value into the function
                                             // that calls it

    let some_string = String::from("yours"); // some_string comes into scope

    some_string                              // some_string is returned and
                                             // moves out to the calling
                                             // function
}

// This function takes a String and returns one
fn takes_and_gives_back(a_string: String) -> String { // a_string comes into
                                                      // scope

    a_string  // a_string is returned and moves out to the calling function
}

Listing 4-4: Transferring ownership of return values

The ownership of a variable follows the same pattern every time: assigning a value to another variable moves it. When a variable that includes data on the heap goes out of scope, the value will be cleaned up by drop unless ownership of the data has been moved to another variable.

While this works, taking ownership and then returning ownership with every function is a bit tedious. What if we want to let a function use a value but not take ownership? It‚Äôs quite annoying that anything we pass in also needs to be passed back if we want to use it again, in addition to any data resulting from the body of the function that we might want to return as well.

Rust does let us return multiple values using a tuple, as shown in Listing 4-5.

Filename: src/main.rs

fn main() {
